Delegate og TDN (The Digital Neighborhood) har valgt at satse massivt på udviklingen af robuste og cutting edge AI løsninger, hvorfor vi får brug for endnu en stærk profil indenfor AI engineering med Azure OpenAI.


Dine arbejdsopgaver:

Du vil indgå i leverancen i forhold til at designe, estimere og implementere projekter. Du kommer potentielt også til at være ansvarlig for planlægning, indsamling af krav og gennemførelse af workshops. Som konsulent i Delegate er din fornemmeste opgave dog at sikre at de AI løsninger, vi leverer til vores kunder, er af højeste kvalitet.


Dine tekniske kvalifikationer:

Krav:

  • Erfaring i Python-udvikling og/eller .NET-udvikling
  • Erfaring med udvikling af Azure OpenAI løsninger
  • Erfaring med:
  • Azure App Service
  • Azure Functions
  • Azure DevOps-pipelines og Bicep/IAC.
  • JSON/Rest API-integration

  • Plusser:

    • Erfaring med:
    • Udvikling af JSON/Rest API'er
    • Azure CLI
    • Azure Managed Identity / RBAC
    • Containere/Docker i praksis
    • Azure DevOps
    • CI/CD og DevOps i praksis
    • Azure Cost Estimation
    • Automatiseret test ud over unit tests
    • Erfaring, uddannelse eller interesse for klassisk maskinlæring



    Professionelle færdigheder

    • Gode kommunikations- og samarbejdsevner
    • Vandt til at arbejde i et agilt udviklingsmiljø
    • Erfaring med tidsestimering og dokumentation af komplekse opgaver
    • Taler og skriver dansk og engelsk.


    Skulle du mangle enkelte af ovenstående kompetencer opfordrer vi dig alligevel til at søge - det allervigtigste hos er, at du har interesse i at udvikle dig og bidrage til videreudviklingen af vores AI-løsninger i et miljø, hvor samarbejde og faglig udvikling er i fokus.


    Niveau

    Consultant / Senior Consultant


    Work from anywhere

    Vi gør meget ud af at skabe rammerne for at kunne balancere arbejdsliv og privatliv. I Delegate har du fuld fleksibilitet til at planlægge din hverdag, så du f.eks. kan hente børnene tidligt, eller lægge din træning midt på dagen, for til gengæld at åbne computeren på et andet tidspunkt, ligesom du har mulighed for at arbejde hjemmefra. Vi kalder det #workfromanywhere. Vi er forpligtet over for hinanden og vores kunder, og derfor stoler vi på, at du også anerkender den betydelige værdi af at møde ind på vores fysiske kontor i løbet af ugen.


    Velkommen hjem

    Hos Delegate bliver du mødt med nærvær og kvalitet på alle niveauer, og vi tager os tid til at hjælpe hinanden og gør os umage for, at både kunder og kollegaer føler sig hjemme. Her kan du udvikle dig i et stærkt fællesskab, hvor du får faglig sparring med dygtige kollegaer, som har lige så høje standarder for løsninger som dig. Samarbejdet med vores kunder er kendetegnet ved gode og afslappede relationer med en åben dialog, hvor kundens team er trygge ved at fortælle dig om behov og udfordringer, fordi de ved, at du sætter en ære i at løse dem.


    Nysgerrig?

    Du må meget gerne booke et uforpligtende og uformelt kaffemøde med Julie Lindvald Thorsen her, hvis du vil høre mere eller har spørgsmål, inden du søger.

    Send din ansøgning ved at klikke på ’Ansøg’ her på siden og følg anvisningerne. Vedhæft dit CV og relevante bilag. Tiltrædelse er snarest muligt, og ansøgninger behandles løbende.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Kickstart din karriere som Data Scientist hos Specialisterne  

Er du klar til at begynde din IT-karriere? Så skal du slå dig sammen med Specialisterne - vi uddanner og ansætter passionerede konsulenter, der elsker at nørde.  

 

Hvem er vi: 

Specialisterne er et IT-konsulenthus, baseret på mangfoldighed, talent og nørderi. De fleste af vores konsulenter er neurodivergente (autisme, ADHD, ADD, OCD, etc.) og er specialiseret indenfor IT og databehandling. Vi elsker at tackle de mest komplekse og udfordrende problemstillinger. Vi er nørderne, som trives med krævende opgaver, hvor dyb faglig viden og kreativ tænkning er afgørende. Hos Specialisterne får du ikke kun en karriere, du bliver en del af et fællesskab, hvor du får muligheden for at udvikle dig som person og til Specialist på dit fagområde. 

Specialisterne har åbnet en ny afdeling med kontor i Aarhus og derfor søger vi IT-konsulenter i hele Danmark. 

 

Ansættelsesprogram hos Specialisterne (Specialisterne Academy): 

Din rejse starter på Specialisterne Academy: Vores særligt tilpassede 12-ugers program. Programmet er fuldt finansieret af din bopælskommune. Du vil modtage din nuværende offentlige forsørgelse under deltagelse. I løbet af 12 uger bliver du uddannet, screenet og klar til at træde ind i IT-branchen som en professionel konsulent.  

På Academy lærer vi dig at kende, forstår dine styrker og uddanner dig i de IT-færdigheder, som vores kunder efterspørger. 

 

Vi underviser i 3 spor, hvor du vælger det, der matcher dine kompetencer og interesser: Dataanalyse, Cyber Security eller Softwareudvikling. 

 

75% af dem, som gennemfører vores Academy, kommer videre i arbejde. Du bliver ansat som konsulent hos os, og arbejder for vores kunder. Vores kunder er m.fl.: Novo Nordisk, Danske Bank, TDC, Semler, SKAT, NNE, Terma. Du vil indenfor 1-2 år blive fastansat hos den kunde, som du primært har været tilknyttet i din tid som konsulent hos os. På den måde sikrer vi, at du lander godt hos din kommende arbejdsgiver, og sikrer, at din arbejdsgiver er trænet i en divers ledelseskultur. 95% af vores tidligere konsulenter er i samme afdeling, hos samme kunde 5 år efter ansættelsen hos os. 

Dataanalyse:

På Akademiets dataanalyse-spor lærer du at kode og arbejde med forretningsdata. Du bliver undervist i kodesproget Python, SQL-databaser og platformen Power BI. Sporet er for dig, der vil hjælpe virksomheder med at forstå og anvende deres data. Du får praktisk erfaring gennem reelle virksomhedscases og datasæt fra vores samarbejdsvirksomheder.

Hvad kan vi tilbyde dig: 

Gode muligheder for job hos nogle af landets største virksomheder, som sammen med os, har fokus på dig og din trivsel. 
Omfattende uddannelse og mulighed for at specialisere dig inden for dit område. 
En inkluderende og mangfoldig arbejdsplads, hvor dine talenter, din indre nørd og dine kompetencer er udgangspunktet for din succes. 
En dynamisk arbejdsplads, hvor vi flere gange om året holder sociale arrangementer med dine kolleger. 
En ledelsesstruktur og -kultur, der giver dig plads til at udfolde dit potentiale. 

 

Vi søger dig, som: 

Er klar til at arbejde 25-37 timer om ugen. 
Kan arbejde 4-5 dage om ugen (med fjernarbejde 1-2 dage pr. uge). 
Er motiveret for at lære og bruge din specialiserede viden til at løse udfordringer for vores kunder. 
Har taget (måske ikke færdiggjort) en uddannelse inden for Tech-området (datalogi, IT-produktudvikling, robotteknologi eller datamatiker) eller det naturvidenskabelige område (biologi, fysisk, kemi, neuroscience), eller STEM-området (ingeniør, matematik, forsikringsmatematik, geologi), eller har taget en helt anden uddannelse, hvor du er blevet opmærksom på dit talent til at behandle data, se detaljer, finde mønstre, kode eller se afvigelser i datasæt. 

 

Ansøg nu, og kickstart din karriere hos Specialisterne!  

Hos Specialisterne er vi optaget af at give dig muligheden for at vise os dine kompetencer. Derfor er vores ansøgningsproces anderledes. Du følger disse 5 trin:  




Du ansøger via vores rekrutteringsplatform, Recruitee, hvor du kort skal svare på 12 spørgsmål samt uploade dit CV. 
Herefter modtager du en bekræftelse pr. mail,
Inden for 1-3 hverdage modtager du en mail (såfremt du er i målgruppe til akademiet), hvorfra du skal booke en kort 15-minutters indledende telefonsamtale med vores recruiter.
Herfra sender vi minimum én faglig screeningsopgaver (maksimalt to), så vi sammen kan komme i dialog om, hvor du står fagligt og hvad du drømmer om.  
Afslutningsvis bliver du inviteret ind til en afsluttende onlinesamtale, hvor vi snakker om dine testresultater og vurderer om Specialisterne er den virksomhed, som skal kickstarte din karriere.  

 

Det er vigtigt for os, at vi sammen vurderer, om vi er det rette match til at kickstarte din karriere. Derfor forsøger vi at gøre tingene anderledes og skaber rum og rammer, der muliggør at vi får indblik i dine talenter og kompetencer.  

Søg snarest, da vi lukker for ansøgninger, når vores program er fyldt. Søg senest primo Januar.

Opstart vil være d. 24.02.25.

 

Se vores Brand video (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2KV_JsK9QtE) og få et indblik i, hvor nørderede, kompetente, seje og mangfoldige vores kolleger er. 

 

Om Specialisterne: 

Diversitet og inklusion er selve kernen af vores arbejde, og en helt central del af Specialisternes globale værdisæt. Vi arbejder hver dag på at skabe en rummelig verden og ikke mindst et rummeligt arbejdsmarked. Vi anerkender, at alle er forskellige og at det at tiltrække, udvikle og fastholde vores medarbejdere vil skabe et bæredygtigt arbejdsmiljø, som er afgørende for vores succes. Vi opfordrer derfor alle til at søge vores ledige stillinger, uanset køn, etnicitet, alder, seksuelle orientering eller neurotype.

Title: Rust Developer
Description:
Sr Rust Developer - LLM

Location: Anywhere in the World Permanent Remote

Contract length - 5 - 20 Months

Opportunity- Full Time, 8 hours, Overlap Required: 5 hours PST

Total Years Of exp: 5+ years experience

Mandatory Skills: min 2.5 years of experience as a Rust Developer

Along with rust backend experience is necessary.

Job Responsibilities


Write effective Rust code to tackle complex issues
Use business sense and analytical abilities to glean valuable insights from public databases
Clearly express the reasoning and logic when writing code in online notebooks or other suitable mediums
Ensure comprehensive code documentation
Coding Best Practices
Problem-Solving
Familiarity with Prompt Engineering (Knows how to use ChatGPT or other GEN AI tools to accelerate themselves while knowing its limitations/pitfalls)
At least 2+ years of relevant experience with Rust
Industry experience and knowledge of code quality, formatting, and best practices of software development
Excellent communication abilities to work with stakeholders and researchers successfully
Fluent in conversational and written English communication skills

Title: Graduate i data science
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
”Hos PFA søger vi en ny graduate med interesse for data og AI. Som medlem af vores AI Community får du mulighed for at anvende din tekniske viden, tage ansvar for spændende projekter og samarbejde med et team af engagerede kollegaer. Som graduate i PFA får du 24 måneders personlig og faglig udvikling – designet til at skyde din karriere i fuld gang,” siger Helle Gormsen, leder af AI Udvikling i PFA.

Du skal forbedre PFA’s digitale løsninger med AI

Bliv en af de to nye graduates i PFA’s AI Community, der består af 30 dedikerede kollegaer. Sammen vil vi anvende data og AI til at skabe branchens bedste kundeoplevelser for PFA’s 1,3 millioner kunder. Siden 2017 har vi arbejdet målrettet med AI-udvikling i PFA, og vi har i dag et modent setup med et AI Community fordelt på to teams med data scientists og data science engineers. Vi dækker hele værdikæden fra idé til produktion og effektmåling, med fokus på løsninger, der gør en reel forskel for både PFA’s kunder og vores kollegers hverdag. Eksempler på vores arbejde inkluderer datadrevne anbefalingsmodeller, skalerbar digital rådgivning og machine learning til målrettet sygdomsforebyggelse.

Hos PFA får du mulighed for at lære en masse og se dit arbejde blive implementeret i vores systemer. Din hverdag bliver en blanding af fordybelse i programmering, data og modeller samt udadvendte aktiviteter som deltagelse i tværfaglige arbejdsgrupper og møder med interne kunder. Du bliver en del af et stærkt socialt og fagligt fællesskab i vores AI Community, hvor vi støtter hinanden og prioriterer aktiviteter som demoer, innovationssprint og Townhall-møder.

Du skal bl.a. arbejde med at:


udvikle AI/ML-løsninger til at understøtte og forbedre PFA’s processer og digitale løsninger
lære at sætte AI-løsninger i produktion og bidrage til drift og lifecycle management
anvende ny teknologi og nye metoder i dine løsninger, fx Cloud-værktøjer og eksterne sprogmodeller fra Azure OpenAI Services
tage ansvar for dine egne projekter (i samarbejde med dit team), formidle resultater og indgå i tværfaglige teams.


To år med fuld fart på din udvikling

Som graduate i PFA bygger du venskaber og netværk med de andre graduates. I er sammen på bootcamps, hvor I får en professionel værktøjskasse med træning i bl.a. problem solving, innovation og facilitering. Programmet er designet til, at du udvikler dig både fagligt og personligt. Du er med i netværk og får en mentor, der sparrer med dig og støtter dig. Du er fastansat og tilknyttet én forretningsenhed gennem hele forløbet på 24 måneder. PFA ligger lige ved Nordhavn Metro og tæt på havnebadet. Her får du de bedste rammer for et fedt arbejdsliv. Vi kan arbejde hjemme op til to dage om ugen, men er generelt ret sociale, så du kan lære flere kolleger at kende fx i fredagscafeen, i vores medarbejderklubber eller på bokse-, løbe- og yogahold.

Kan du se dig selv som PFA’er?

For at blive graduate i PFA skal du have en kandidatgrad, og det må max være to år siden, du dimitterede, når programmet starter til september. Du trives med at arbejde med komplekse problemstillinger og forvandle dem til innovative løsninger. Og så har du evner, vilje og interesse for at blive klogere - og spille dine kollegaer gode. Måske kender du også lidt til PFA og synes, at vores kundefællesskab og samfundsansvarlige agenda er helt rigtig.

Du:


er kandidat eller snart færdiguddannet inden for data science, naturvidenskab, civilingeniør, computer science eller lignende områder
har erfaring med Python og stor interesse for data, AI, machine learning og programmering
er dygtig til at skrive kode, analytisk tænkende og god til at løse problemer og generere idéer
værdsætter samarbejde med kollegaer for at udvikle de bedste løsninger sammen.


Ansøg nu – og begynd nedtællingen til september 2025

Send din ansøgning og CV hurtigst muligt og senest den 21. januar 2025. Alle vores graduates begynder som udgangspunkt den 1. september 2025. Du kan læse mere om PFA’s graduate program her Graduate.

Tag endelig fat i os

Har du spørgsmål til den konkrete stilling, kan du kontakte Caroline Amalie Fuglsang-Damgaard, der er Data Scientist i AI Udvikling i PFA, på tlf.: 23 81 06 36. Har du spørgsmål til Graduate programmet, kan du skrive til Karina Roulund Bergmann på krb@pfa.dk.

Vi samarbejder for at vores kunder kan leve et godt liv – både nu og i fremtiden

I PFA bliver du en del af noget stort – både som kunde og som kollega. Vi er omkring 1500 kolleger, der hver dag samarbejder for at gøre en positiv forskel for vores mere end 1,3 mio. kunder og samfund. Vi arbejder for at sikre økonomisk tryghed og sundhed gennem arbejdsliv og gode seniorliv for PFA er med vores kunder hele livet.
Show more
HTML:
”Hos PFA søger vi en ny graduate med interesse for data og AI. Som medlem af vores AI Community får du mulighed for at anvende din tekniske viden, tage ansvar for spændende projekter og samarbejde med et team af engagerede kollegaer. Som graduate i PFA får du 24 måneders personlig og faglig udvikling – designet til at skyde din karriere i fuld gang,” siger Helle Gormsen, leder af AI Udvikling i PFA.

Du skal forbedre PFA’s digitale løsninger med AI

Bliv en af de to nye graduates i PFA’s AI Community, der består af 30 dedikerede kollegaer. Sammen vil vi anvende data og AI til at skabe branchens bedste kundeoplevelser for PFA’s 1,3 millioner kunder. Siden 2017 har vi arbejdet målrettet med AI-udvikling i PFA, og vi har i dag et modent setup med et AI Community fordelt på to teams med data scientists og data science engineers. Vi dækker hele værdikæden fra idé til produktion og effektmåling, med fokus på løsninger, der gør en reel forskel for både PFA’s kunder og vores kollegers hverdag. Eksempler på vores arbejde inkluderer datadrevne anbefalingsmodeller, skalerbar digital rådgivning og machine learning til målrettet sygdomsforebyggelse.

Hos PFA får du mulighed for at lære en masse og se dit arbejde blive implementeret i vores systemer. Din hverdag bliver en blanding af fordybelse i programmering, data og modeller samt udadvendte aktiviteter som deltagelse i tværfaglige arbejdsgrupper og møder med interne kunder. Du bliver en del af et stærkt socialt og fagligt fællesskab i vores AI Community, hvor vi støtter hinanden og prioriterer aktiviteter som demoer, innovationssprint og Townhall-møder.

Du skal bl.a. arbejde med at:

  • udvikle AI/ML-løsninger til at understøtte og forbedre PFA’s processer og digitale løsninger
  • lære at sætte AI-løsninger i produktion og bidrage til drift og lifecycle management
  • anvende ny teknologi og nye metoder i dine løsninger, fx Cloud-værktøjer og eksterne sprogmodeller fra Azure OpenAI Services
  • tage ansvar for dine egne projekter (i samarbejde med dit team), formidle resultater og indgå i tværfaglige teams.

To år med fuld fart på din udvikling

Som graduate i PFA bygger du venskaber og netværk med de andre graduates. I er sammen på bootcamps, hvor I får en professionel værktøjskasse med træning i bl.a. problem solving, innovation og facilitering. Programmet er designet til, at du udvikler dig både fagligt og personligt. Du er med i netværk og får en mentor, der sparrer med dig og støtter dig. Du er fastansat og tilknyttet én forretningsenhed gennem hele forløbet på 24 måneder. PFA ligger lige ved Nordhavn Metro og tæt på havnebadet. Her får du de bedste rammer for et fedt arbejdsliv. Vi kan arbejde hjemme op til to dage om ugen, men er generelt ret sociale, så du kan lære flere kolleger at kende fx i fredagscafeen, i vores medarbejderklubber eller på bokse-, løbe- og yogahold.

Kan du se dig selv som PFA’er?

For at blive graduate i PFA skal du have en kandidatgrad, og det må max være to år siden, du dimitterede, når programmet starter til september. Du trives med at arbejde med komplekse problemstillinger og forvandle dem til innovative løsninger. Og så har du evner, vilje og interesse for at blive klogere - og spille dine kollegaer gode. Måske kender du også lidt til PFA og synes, at vores kundefællesskab og samfundsansvarlige agenda er helt rigtig.

Du:

  • er kandidat eller snart færdiguddannet inden for data science, naturvidenskab, civilingeniør, computer science eller lignende områder
  • har erfaring med Python og stor interesse for data, AI, machine learning og programmering
  • er dygtig til at skrive kode, analytisk tænkende og god til at løse problemer og generere idéer
  • værdsætter samarbejde med kollegaer for at udvikle de bedste løsninger sammen.

Ansøg nu – og begynd nedtællingen til september 2025

Send din ansøgning og CV hurtigst muligt og senest den 21. januar 2025. Alle vores graduates begynder som udgangspunkt den 1. september 2025. Du kan læse mere om PFA’s graduate program her Graduate.

Tag endelig fat i os

Har du spørgsmål til den konkrete stilling, kan du kontakte Caroline Amalie Fuglsang-Damgaard, der er Data Scientist i AI Udvikling i PFA, på tlf.: 23 81 06 36. Har du spørgsmål til Graduate programmet, kan du skrive til Karina Roulund Bergmann på krb@pfa.dk.

Vi samarbejder for at vores kunder kan leve et godt liv – både nu og i fremtiden

I PFA bliver du en del af noget stort – både som kunde og som kollega. Vi er omkring 1500 kolleger, der hver dag samarbejder for at gøre en positiv forskel for vores mere end 1,3 mio. kunder og samfund. Vi arbejder for at sikre økonomisk tryghed og sundhed gennem arbejdsliv og gode seniorliv for PFA er med vores kunder hele livet.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer (Freelancer)
Description:
Defence projects, unlocked.




At Defence.Works, we match you with the industry's top R&D projects and help you deliver impact for a safer tomorrow.




With Defence.Works, you will get access to interesting projects without consuming time on sales and project hunting. Our platform allows us to keep our organization structure thin, which means less internal costs, more value to customers, and higher rates for you.




As an Artificial Intelligence Engineer you will join our trusted network to work on cutting-edge R&D projects in the defense sector, contributing to innovative solutions that enhance safety and security for a safer tomorrow. You will bring deep expertise in machine learning and artificial intelligence, ideally with prior experience in developing autonomous products, radar systems, or applications that heavily leverage AI capabilities. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of building secure, high-performing solutions designed to meet the defense industry's rigorous standards.




Your presence can be in Northern Europe (Finland, Sweden, Norway, Denmark), United Kingdom, or Germany and you are eligible to pass security-clearance before starting on a project. Please notice that consultants might need to pass security clearance before starting on a project.




Responsibilities:

Design, implement, and optimize AI models and algorithms for defense sector applications, including autonomous systems, radars, and AI-driven decision-making tools.
Develop secure, high-performance software solutions tailored to meet the stringent requirements of defense industry projects.
Identify and address vulnerabilities in AI systems, ensuring robust cybersecurity measures are integrated throughout the development lifecycle.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align AI capabilities with overall system architectures, ensuring seamless integration and performance.
Conduct rigorous testing, validation, and documentation of AI solutions to ensure reliability, scalability, and compliance with industry standards.




Qualifications:

Master's or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Machine Learning, or related field
Strong skills in Pattern Recognition, Neural Networks, and Algorithms.
Experience from developing products which rely on AI/ML capabilities such as autonomous systems, radar technologies, or other AI-reliant defense applications.
Expertise in machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch) and programming languages such as Python, C++, or Java.
Familiarity with secure system design, cybersecurity principles, and compliance with defense-specific regulations.




Additional Requirements:

Security certifications or training (e.g., CISSP, CEH) are highly desirable.




Next steps:

Press "Apply"
Submit your resume on Hashlist platform (takes 5 minutes). Hashlist is our parental company which infrastructure we are utilizing to manage the profiles
We will review your profile and if your profile matches our criteria
We call you and make sure that your expectations and career ambitions are aligned with our offer.
You will get accepted to our trusted network of partners and our clients and receive offers from different clients who are looking for your expertise
Show more

Title: Applied Research Scientist - Digital Enterprise Transformation
Place: Hedehusene, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Req Number: 89881

Time Type: Full Time

Do you want to push the boundaries of machine learning and scale it to users across the world? Do you wish for a product centric work environment, where machine learning and analytics drive action – not just insight?

With a strong focus on the applied machine learning research discipline, you will take part in innovation and design of new products, as well as tweak and mature existing ones. You will join a team of highly talented data scientists and collaborate with several product teams consisting of product owners, backend- and frontend developers and DevSecOps specialists. You will be pushing the applied research agenda, aiming to create and continuously innovate the ML systems of tomorrow.

Join a department focused on our most valuable digital products

You will join the Research and AI Lab team in the Digital Enterprise Transformation department. Our new Research and AI Lab unit is characterized by having an intrapreneurial mindset, and is collaborating holistically with established MLOps, DevSecOps and

Data Science teams that have had ML systems in production on a global scale for several years. We strive to base our work on knowledge and insight rather than hierarchical structures, and we make sure that our decisions are based on conversations between people with different competencies rather than one individual.

Examples of what we have worked on in 2024:



Trained, tuned, and served large generative language models for document processing and for conversation using both text and multimodal data.
Designed a new large machine learning system set for release in early 2025.
Implemented and deployed an ‘attention-free’ transformer model, including functionality for large-scale model training and inference.



Current plans set for 2025:



Establish an industrial research presence, including publishing our work in relevant ML journals/conferences and collaboration with academic research institutions.
Become creators rather than consumers in GenAI and multimodal machine learning.
And more!



You thrive when solving highly complex challenges

The use cases we handle tend to have a high degree of complexity, requiring non-deterministic problem solving (i.e., the use of ML/AI), near real-time data processing, a need for high availability, vertical and horizontal scalability, and a very high volume of transactions. Solving complex problems with the use of machine learning, you need an open and analytical mind, finding pragmatic solutions that balance between the theoretical standpoint and what is possible .

Be the driver of our AI/ML and GenAI journey

As our Applied Research Scientist, your work will be multifaceted. We will work on our research agenda and push for new machine learning applications and methods, while ensuring this work is well-adopted by the existing teams for use in downstream products that will directly impact DSV’s divisions. You will have a mix of independent work and participate in existing project-focused teams.

Responsibilities:



Advance GenAI and multimodal research and development: Spearhead applied research in GenAI and multimodal machine learning, encompassing image, layout, and text/language modeling.
Drive applied research that can be applied to DSV’s product development. Drive cross-project innovation to tackle complex challenges and real-world problems to gain new insights and apply findings to enhance model performance and outcomes.
Foundational model development: Independently architect, train, and evaluate foundational models to advance GenAI LLMs and multimodal systems in DSV’s field of work.



Skills and experience we value and would love you to have already:



Educational Background: Preferably a PhD or master's degree in CS, CE, ML or a related field, with proven research experience.
Strong Theoretical Foundation: A comprehensive skill set in mathematics, statistics, and algorithms is essential for implementing research ideas, building upon existing research to create new, and adapting established work to our domain.
Software Development: A good understanding of core programming and development concepts: data structures, algorithms, and object-oriented programming. You will both be performing rapid prototyping and contribute to large collaborative machine learning codebases. We primarily use Python due to the high availability of machine learning frameworks.
Publications and Open-Source Contributions: Proven track record of first-author peer-reviewed publications that demonstrate your ability to lead research projects and navigate the publication process, along with contributions to open-source projects.
Model Development and Architecture: Proficiency in building from scratch, modifying and optimizing existing models and in advanced model architectures, particularly for GenAI and multimodal applications .
Accelerated and Distributed Compute: Proficiency in accelerated parallel computing, including scalable data processing and leveraging of GPU technology for enhanced performance and model training scalability. We use frameworks such as: PyTorch, Kedro, Apache Beam, and more.
Continuous Learning: Commitment to staying current with the latest advancements in machine learning and applying new academic insights to solve complex business challenges.
Practical Experience: Hands-on experience with large-scale, real-world machine learning projects.
Self-Starter & Ownership: We're looking for someone who is proactive, takes initiative, and can drive projects independently. You should be comfortable taking ownership of objectives and pushing things forward.



We understand that no candidate may meet every single requirement listed here. If you meet some of the qualifications, but not all, we still encourage you to apply! We're looking for passionate individuals who are eager to grow and contribute to our team.

What we offer to you:



Direct Communication: We engage directly with VP and C-level stakeholders, ensuring your insights and contributions are heard at the highest levels.
Influence on MLOps: Play a key role in shaping our mature, in-house MLOps platform, working with a dynamic and growing team.
Global Scale Experience: Leverage our extensive experience with ML systems in production on a global scale, benefiting from our experience in development and operations processes for large-scale machine learning systems.
A proven team: A group which is already self-financed based on realized returns of machine learning business cases.
Research and AI Lab: Be part of our new Research and AI Lab initiative, where you can influence methodologies, the direction, and the research agenda.



If you want to apply

We will be happy to answer any questions you may have regarding the position and about your options in DSV. You are welcome to call Ramus Kær Jørgensen on +45 25452587.

We look forward to receiving your application as soon as possible. We will process the applications as we receive them.

DSV – Global Transport and Logistics

DSV is a dynamic workplace that fosters inclusivity and diversity. We conduct our business with integrity, respecting different cultures and the dignity and rights of individuals. When you join DSV, you are working for one of the very best performing companies in the transport and logistics industry. You’ll join a talented team of approximately 75,000 employees in over 80 countries, working passionately to deliver great customer experiences and high-quality services. DSV aspires to lead the way towards a more sustainable future for our industry and are committed to trading on nature’s terms.

We promote collaboration and transparency and strive to attract, motivate and retain talented people in a culture of respect. If you are driven, talented and wish to be part of a progressive and versatile organisation, we’ll support you and your need to achieve your potential and forward your career.

Visit dsv.com and follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and Twitter.

Title: Senior Data Scientist for Performance Management and Analytics
Description:
As a Data Scientist, you will enhance predictive analytics, build automation and drive impactful improvements across the organisation.

Data Scientist specialising in process performance
As a Data Scientist specialising in process performance, you will enhance and automate predictive performance models. You will unlock new potential through AI and machine learning to predict outcomes while ensuring the consistent use of standardised data, methods and measures across the organisation. Additionally, you will support and validate critical KPIs.

Systematic is rated at CMMI Maturity Level 5, a distinction held by only a few companies worldwide. Your work will help maintain this high maturity level through clear and impactful process performance reporting combined with effective measurement of our improvement initiatives.

This is a newly established role, created as part of our ambition to elevate our performance management capability to the next level!

In this role, you will collaborate with teams across the organisation to turn data into actionable insights, ensuring that our processes are optimised and consistent and aligned with business goals. Your key responsibilities include:


Developing and validating process-performance models:
Gathering and validating data to build reliable models that reflect business needs.
Automating and improving reporting:
Enhancing quarterly process-performance baseline reporting and contributing to the Wall of Fame initiative.
Supporting master data quality.
Analysing data to provide the insights needed for precise and quantitative decisions.
Automating and improving prediction through the use of statistical techniques, machine learning and/or AI.
Participating in CMMI Appraisals.



The team
You will be part of a small, dedicated team of highly skilled specialists. Organised within the Finance department, the team collaborates closely with our internal Business Intelligence team and our Business Process Management team. Most importantly, it works across the organisation to support our programme managers in achieving process performance objectives. The team’s mission is to ensure, maintain and enhance a high level of maturity throughout Systematic.

Driven by automation and predictive analysis
We are looking for an experienced and driven candidate with a relevant bachelor’s or master’s degree who is passionate about automation and predictive analysis.

You thrive on working with data, statistics and numbers, and your structured approach ensures high-quality results.
At the same time, you have the curiosity and creativity to think outside the box and find innovative solutions.
We expect you to have several years of experience with R, VBA, robotics or similar, and the ability to leverage these technologies to drive automations.
You are proactive, motivated to push things forward and you enjoy working at the intersection of data, technology and business optimisation.



Please note that you must be able to present a clean criminal record and have lived in a NATO/EU country for the past seven years as we work with security-classified projects. Read more here.

Never stop developing
Systematic is truly international, proudly Danish and uniquely people centric. Together, we write intelligent and innovative code to drive progress and improve lives. We develop IT solutions that make a real difference where it matters most. This is why we never stop developing. Here, there is room to be professional and personal. Systematic is not just a place to work but a place to belong.

You can look forward to joining our Employees Club, which organises almost 100 social/professional events a year – plenty to choose from. Our colleagues also highlight our canteen, which serves a variety of delicious and healthy dishes each day. Finally, we are always up for a friendly game of padel at our padel court in Aarhus!

Start your development here
We will be assessing applications on an ongoing basis as we wish to welcome our new colleague as soon as possible, so click Apply Now and send us your CV today. If you have any questions, you are always welcome to contact us on tel. +45 8943 2000 and ask for Bettina Damm, Senior Specialist.

Please be aware that response times may be longer due to Christmas holidays.

Get in touch

Sofie Heiner Emborg

Senior Talent Acquisition Consultant

Title: Software Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
BLAST is growing rapidly and we are looking to push the limits of technology even further in order to deliver the best experience for our fans all over the world - from large-scale stadium events to intimate studio experiences.

We are looking for a software engineer to help us build reliable and high performance systems for our events. Our team focuses on developing a very wide array of systems - often related to integration with the different games we do. This involves everything from game statistics processing to real-time data visualizations (such as game HUDs, broadcast graphics or stage visuals/automations) and tools used by our production team.

There are always projects coming in, but we also encourage taking time to explore and learn new things. Our goal is to always look for new ways to use technology and constantly push the boundaries of what is possible.

Most of our systems run on-site in our studios or at our live events all over the world - some of which you will be attending to ensure successful delivery and troubleshoot any potential issues.

The team

You will be working in a small engineering team where everyone has a voice throughout the entire process - from ideation together with our product teams to what technologies and architecture we should use. There are often new projects to work on, which also means workdays will be very varied.

You will have frequent 1:1s with your manager, through which you will be able to work on your personal development and growth, by setting clear goals and getting, as well as providing, direct and actionable feedback.

Our culture is very informal where everyone is involved in planning and executing. We value the input of everyone and are not afraid of having discussions on everything from high-level ideas to what technologies we should use. We always want to improve and learn new things, and want you to always share your opinion. While we do run quickly, our main objective is that everyone enjoys being part of the team at BLAST

We also offer


An opportunity to help build a variety of new products
A varied workday with a team of awesome colleagues
Time to innovate and research technologies and learn new things
Picking your own high-end equipment and accessories



Requirements


Relevant degree (eg. Computer Science or Engineering) or equivalent experience
Curious, quick learner and eager to master new technologies
Experience with modern JavaScript
Ability to work at our office in Copenhagen
Ability to travel to and work at events


Responsibilities


Help build innovative solutions for our events
Take part in planning and scoping of deliveries
Perform setup, troubleshooting and debugging at events
Help drive innovation across our projects as well as how we build software
Take part in creating an engaging working environment


Bonus points


Experience with TypeScript and frontend frameworks (eg. Vue, React, Angular)
Familiarity with live broadcasting and equipment
Experience working at live events
Interest in esports



Benefits


Competitive salary package
Enhanced parental leave
Pension and Health Insurance
Awesome new office in the centre of Copenhagen
Team building and social events
Lunch, snacks and sodas
Company trips (2024 we all went to Barcelona and had a BLAST)
Show more

Title: Software Engineer (with a passion for data)
Place: Billund, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Are you a software engineer with a passion for data? or, a data engineer with an interest in creating software solutions?

Either way, this role is what you've been waiting for if you're passionate about data and software!

The partner area develops innovative IT solutions to help our partners optimize their selling processes, achieve seamless content integrations, and effectively capture sales data.

Responsibilities





Work closely with product managers, designers, data specialists, and fellow engineers to
Gather and interpret requirements
Transform requirements into effective technical solutions
Adopt DevOps principles
Design, code, deploy, and maintain backend services and data pipelines
Prioritize the success of the group with a strong team-first mentality
Actively support colleagues in achieving shared goals




Requirements





Demonstrated expertise in foundational programming concepts is essential.
Solid understanding of data warehousing concepts, cloud technologies, data modelling, data governance.
Relevant experience using SQL, dbt, Python, Spark, Databricks, AWS stack or any other cloud technologies or similar tech stack.
Ability to take end-to-end responsibility of designing and developing data products starting from requirement scoping to delivery having a keen eye for automation.
Experience in building efficient data pipelines, ability to navigate through complex scripts and work on performance tuning.
Experience with agile ways of working
Focused on quality at all stages of the software lifecycle
Ability to troubleshoot, research, and work through complex problems
Excellent written and verbal communication skills




Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

Research shows that women and people from different underrepresented backgrounds often only apply for a job if they meet 100% of the listed qualifications. If you dream of being a part of our team and you meet many, but not all of our listed qualifications for this role, please apply.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.

Title: Data Scientist Specialist - Be a key player for the success of our cutting-edge product SitaWare
Description:
Data Scientist Specialist – Be a key player for the success of our cutting-edge product SitaWare Insight

Unlock the power of data and shape the future of defence decision support with SitaWare Insight! As a Data Scientist, you will be at the forefront of developing cutting-edge machine learning models, ensuring seamless integration with our advanced decision support tool. Join us and become part of a dynamic team that simplifies critical decision-making for commanders worldwide.

A data professional
Join the SitaWare Insight team in Denmark, a forward-thinking product organisation dedicated to driving innovation in defence technology. With a high focus on simplifying decision-making processes, the team comprises a cohesive group of skilled professionals, including a Project Manager, Product Manager, Architect, Developers and a System Tester. Collaborate in an environment committed to growth, improvement and maintaining excellence in our product – a responsibility that is pivotal to meeting the increasing demand from our global customers.

Drive data excellence
Shape the future of defence decision support in this hands-on Data Scientist role. Work on a broad spectrum of tasks, including data analyses, model development, collaboration with MLOps, deployment and performance monitoring in production. As a key player in advancing SitaWare Insight, you will contribute to new releases every half-year, introducing novel capabilities, bug fixes and overall product enhancements.

In short, you can look forward to:


Developing high-quality machine learning models to enhance decision support
Collaborating with MLOps for the seamless integration of models
Monitoring model performance in a dynamic production environment
Contributing to the growth, improvement and maintenance of SitaWare Insight



Proficient data expert
You are passionate about transforming data into actionable insights, and bring the following to the role:


Proven experience as a Data Scientist
Minimum of a Master’s or PhD in a relevant field (e.g. computer science, data science, cognitive science and statistics)
Demonstrated expertise in developing and implementing machine learning models
Strong programming skills in Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch
Proficiency in data preprocessing and feature engineering
Database knowledge for effective data management
Computer science skills supporting the overall development of the data science service like Docker and CI/CD pipelines
Solid understanding of model evaluation, documentation, visualisation of data-driven solutions and development best-practices
Appreciate teamwork and sparring with colleagues
Great communication skills
Proficient in English



Please note that you must be able to present a clean criminal record and have lived in a NATO/EU country for the past seven years as we work with security-classified projects. Read more here.

Never stop developing
Systematic is truly international, proudly Danish and uniquely people-centric. Together, we write intelligent and innovative code to drive progress and improve lives. We develop IT solutions that make a real difference where it matters most. This is why we never stop developing. Here, there is room to be professional and personal. It is not just a place to work but a place to belong. You can look forward to joining our Employees Club offering almost 100 social/professional events a year – plenty to choose from. Our colleagues also highlight our canteen, which serves a variety of delicious and healthy dishes each day. In addition, we offer several employee benefits such as paid Home Internet, health insurance and a company pension scheme. Finally, we are always up for a friendly game of padel at our new padel court in Aarhus!

Start your development here
We will be assessing applications on an ongoing basis as we wish to welcome our new colleague as soon as possible, so click Apply Now and send us your CV today. If you have any questions, you are always welcome to contact us on tel. +45 8943 2000 and ask for Preben Schmidt Nielsen, Senior Project Manager.

Get in touch

Mette Mørch Rasmussen

Senior Talent Acquisition Consultant


Show more

Title: Senior manager, Data scientist in Corporate Finance
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

This role is a strong opportunity to elevate digitalization in financial planning in the LEGO Group and to gain E2E knowledge on the LEGO Group's financial processes and grow a strong network across the organization!

As part of the Corporate reporting and planning team, you will play a key role in using data and drive innovation and continuous improvement in the financial planning processes and build on your already excellent finance data scientist career!

No relocation assistance is offered for this position


Core Responsibilities





Drive the aspiration on business analysis and push the data focus in defining the new financial planning processes
Leverage data driven forecasting in financial planning e.g. via driver-based planning, predictive planning and sensible machine learning to drive automation and reduced cycle time with less effort
Engage with partners across Finance to drive the implementation and support the change journey
Be one of the subject matter experts training and supporting colleagues building confidence in the data driven approach
Co-drive validation and recommendation on the model selection in a new forecast engine in collaboration with the technical developers
Prepare the reporting supporting transparency in the models and building a storyline on the development




Play your part in our team succeeding

Do you have what it takes?

We expect our preferred candidate to hold a Master's degree in Data science/Data engineering/ Economics / Finance or similar





5-8 years of experience with data science or data engineering, preferably with a focus on finance
Strong analytical skills and experience with predictive planning/ machine learning /Python/R or similar
Superb communication and collaboration skills
Location in Billund or Copenhagen office




Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

Research shows that women and people from different underrepresented backgrounds often only apply for a job if they meet 100% of the listed qualifications. If you dream of being a part of our team and you meet many, but not all of our listed qualifications for this role, please apply.

Title: Junior Platform Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Who are we?




We are Penneo, and we are on a mission to scale!

At Penneo, we want to build a world where you can trust the way businesses do business.

Penneo combines digital signing and Know Your Customer (KYC) workflows into a single platform that streamlines critical business processes for anti-money-laundering regulated B2B companies.

Founded in Copenhagen and operating throughout Europe, Penneo is fast becoming the go-to platform for companies looking to save time on administrative tasks while ensuring complete regulatory compliance and peace of mind for themselves and their clients.

Following our listing on Nasdaq Copenhagen Main Market in April 2022, we are now more than ever in a position to execute our European expansion strategy and scale our operations to maximize value to our existing and future customers.




Who are we looking for?

At Penneo, we are always looking to forge new long-term relationships with people who resonate with our culture and values and are passionate about getting Penneo to the next level.




Do you want to be part of it?

We are now hiring a Junior Platform Engineer who will work with the rest of the team to facilitate the building and operations of the Platform; you will be mentored directly on the tools and techniques used in this GitOps centric team. As you grow in your skill set you will be expected to pick up your own projects and grow towards becoming a Senior Platform Engineer.

You will report to our Director of Platform and have our awesome Engineering Teams as your closest collaborators.

This is a full-time position at our Penneo HQ in Copenhagen, Denmark.




About the team

Previously called “Infrastructure Team”, The Platform Team was rebranded to better fit our ambitions to build a platform that can be used across products to enable our engineers to be more independent.

To fit the growth of our Engineering department, we want to scale the Platform team to meet the demands of the other product teams. The good news is that joining a growing team will give you the opportunity to shape how this team evolves, which best practices to follow, and establish ways of working. The Platform team is growing and is currently formed by the Director of Platform and two Senior Platform Engineers. The Engineering team consists of 20+ people, and zooming out, Penneo as a whole, recently became a 100+ people company.




What would be your responsibilities?

A big part of your role will be developing, deploying, and maintaining DevOps tooling and Infrastructure to make the software delivery system run smoothly. This also involves building reusable components, creating new and maintaining existing environments.

Supporting the development teams in getting code into production and providing them with the needed self service tooling to accelerate their daily work.

You will be expected to learn to design, plan and implement secure and reliable infrastructure and then maintain it through its lifecycles.




You will also be expected to

Help design well-architected solutions, based on proven design patterns or paradigms.
Facilitate initiatives to improve any aspect of the Platform like reliability, performance, security, costs, etc.
Approach challenges in a creative and innovative manner, always trying to find the optimal solution for each requirement.
Collaborate closely with others, specially but not limited to product teams, developers, and senior management.
Keep up to speed with emerging technologies, learn new skills (how to make use of them too!).




What makes you a great match?

Even though we appreciate your experience with other technologies and tools, we are currently specifically looking for someone that has experience with the following

Cloud Providers : Amazon Web Services
Infrastructure as Code : Ansible, Terraform.
CI/CD Platforms : GitHub Actions
Kubernetes : Service Meshes, CNIs, Runtime Security, CRDs, Operators, Sidecars.
Logging : Loki
Metrics : Prometheus and CloudWatch
Tracing : Jaeger, OpenTelemetry (experience with Grafana Tempo is a plus)
Cloud Networking : Experience with L3/L4 Firewalls, Routing, and IPSec VPNs (BGP, AWS Transit Gateway, and DirectConnect are a plus). Knowledge of Juniper Routing/Switching is nice to have.
Software Engineering : Experience with Python.
PKI : Experience with OpenSSL, certificate lifecycle are a plus.




Every engineer has a unique mix of skills and experience, we will definitely take into consideration any relevant experience outside the ones mentioned above. The list above aims to showcase what kind of talent we are looking for. If you want deeper insights into our stack, check https://stackshare.io/penneo/platform




How will this role progress?

It is important to us to be as transparent as possible and to allow you to level expectations for the role. Therefore, we share our impact description in advance and would love your thoughts about it in your cover letter.




During the 1st month, you will:

Meet your new colleagues and understand who is doing what
Get comfortable with the day-to-day operations of the Platform Engineering Team
Understand the problems Penneo solves for customers
Fulfill onboarding requirements, obtain credentials and required accesses
Get acquainted with the Platform Engineering team’s Roadmap
Improve or add missing documentation while going through the setup and onboarding process
Make your first contribution to the platform codebase




Within 3 months, you will:

Contribute individually to changes
Familiarize yourself with the architectures of all products
Identify opportunities to automate processes throughout the software development lifecycle




Within 6 months, you will:

Feel comfortable working with most of the products and engineering teams
Be able to propose, plan and execute improvements from the platform roadmap
Understand how to troubleshoot bugs and handle incidents in production environments




Within 12 months, you will:

Have contributed individually to our products and the platform




At this point, we want to support you in expressing your ambitious growth aspirations, and we're eager to learn on the journey with you. It all depends on your capabilities for continuous learning and, equally important - your dreams for the future.

By now, we hope you're sitting with a smile on your face, ready to apply and contribute to the Penneo adventure.




Best of success with your application!




We are screening and interviewing on an ongoing basis. If you are interested in any of our roles, please do not hesitate to submit your application.




Penneo is an equal-opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, hiring, and promotion are based on merit and business needs. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, or expression.

Please be aware that if hired, as part of our Background check, we require a copy of your criminal record. We do that to ensure that we remain a trusted service provider and partner as well as to comply with relevant compliance requirements such as ISO27001.

Show more
HTML:
Who are we?


We are Penneo, and we are on a mission to scale!

At Penneo, we want to build a world where you can trust the way businesses do business.

Penneo combines digital signing and Know Your Customer (KYC) workflows into a single platform that streamlines critical business processes for anti-money-laundering regulated B2B companies.

Founded in Copenhagen and operating throughout Europe, Penneo is fast becoming the go-to platform for companies looking to save time on administrative tasks while ensuring complete regulatory compliance and peace of mind for themselves and their clients.

Following our listing on Nasdaq Copenhagen Main Market in April 2022, we are now more than ever in a position to execute our European expansion strategy and scale our operations to maximize value to our existing and future customers.


Who are we looking for?

At Penneo, we are always looking to forge new long-term relationships with people who resonate with our culture and values and are passionate about getting Penneo to the next level.


Do you want to be part of it?

We are now hiring a Junior Platform Engineer who will work with the rest of the team to facilitate the building and operations of the Platform; you will be mentored directly on the tools and techniques used in this GitOps centric team. As you grow in your skill set you will be expected to pick up your own projects and grow towards becoming a Senior Platform Engineer.

You will report to our Director of Platform and have our awesome Engineering Teams as your closest collaborators.

This is a full-time position at our Penneo HQ in Copenhagen, Denmark.


About the team

Previously called “Infrastructure Team”, The Platform Team was rebranded to better fit our ambitions to build a platform that can be used across products to enable our engineers to be more independent.

To fit the growth of our Engineering department, we want to scale the Platform team to meet the demands of the other product teams. The good news is that joining a growing team will give you the opportunity to shape how this team evolves, which best practices to follow, and establish ways of working. The Platform team is growing and is currently formed by the Director of Platform and two Senior Platform Engineers. The Engineering team consists of 20+ people, and zooming out, Penneo as a whole, recently became a 100+ people company.


What would be your responsibilities?

A big part of your role will be developing, deploying, and maintaining DevOps tooling and Infrastructure to make the software delivery system run smoothly. This also involves building reusable components, creating new and maintaining existing environments.

Supporting the development teams in getting code into production and providing them with the needed self service tooling to accelerate their daily work.

You will be expected to learn to design, plan and implement secure and reliable infrastructure and then maintain it through its lifecycles.


You will also be expected to

  • Help design well-architected solutions, based on proven design patterns or paradigms.
  • Facilitate initiatives to improve any aspect of the Platform like reliability, performance, security, costs, etc.
  • Approach challenges in a creative and innovative manner, always trying to find the optimal solution for each requirement.
  • Collaborate closely with others, specially but not limited to product teams, developers, and senior management.
  • Keep up to speed with emerging technologies, learn new skills (how to make use of them too!).


What makes you a great match?

Even though we appreciate your experience with other technologies and tools, we are currently specifically looking for someone that has experience with the following

  • Cloud Providers : Amazon Web Services
  • Infrastructure as Code : Ansible, Terraform.
  • CI/CD Platforms : GitHub Actions
  • Kubernetes : Service Meshes, CNIs, Runtime Security, CRDs, Operators, Sidecars.
  • Logging : Loki
  • Metrics : Prometheus and CloudWatch
  • Tracing : Jaeger, OpenTelemetry (experience with Grafana Tempo is a plus)
  • Cloud Networking : Experience with L3/L4 Firewalls, Routing, and IPSec VPNs (BGP, AWS Transit Gateway, and DirectConnect are a plus). Knowledge of Juniper Routing/Switching is nice to have.
  • Software Engineering : Experience with Python.
  • PKI : Experience with OpenSSL, certificate lifecycle are a plus.


Every engineer has a unique mix of skills and experience, we will definitely take into consideration any relevant experience outside the ones mentioned above. The list above aims to showcase what kind of talent we are looking for. If you want deeper insights into our stack, check https://stackshare.io/penneo/platform


How will this role progress?

It is important to us to be as transparent as possible and to allow you to level expectations for the role. Therefore, we share our impact description in advance and would love your thoughts about it in your cover letter.


During the 1st month, you will:

  • Meet your new colleagues and understand who is doing what
  • Get comfortable with the day-to-day operations of the Platform Engineering Team
  • Understand the problems Penneo solves for customers
  • Fulfill onboarding requirements, obtain credentials and required accesses
  • Get acquainted with the Platform Engineering team’s Roadmap
  • Improve or add missing documentation while going through the setup and onboarding process
  • Make your first contribution to the platform codebase


Within 3 months, you will:

  • Contribute individually to changes
  • Familiarize yourself with the architectures of all products
  • Identify opportunities to automate processes throughout the software development lifecycle


Within 6 months, you will:

  • Feel comfortable working with most of the products and engineering teams
  • Be able to propose, plan and execute improvements from the platform roadmap
  • Understand how to troubleshoot bugs and handle incidents in production environments


Within 12 months, you will:

  • Have contributed individually to our products and the platform


At this point, we want to support you in expressing your ambitious growth aspirations, and we're eager to learn on the journey with you. It all depends on your capabilities for continuous learning and, equally important - your dreams for the future.

By now, we hope you're sitting with a smile on your face, ready to apply and contribute to the Penneo adventure.


Best of success with your application!


We are screening and interviewing on an ongoing basis. If you are interested in any of our roles, please do not hesitate to submit your application.


Penneo is an equal-opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, hiring, and promotion are based on merit and business needs. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, or expression.

Please be aware that if hired, as part of our Background check, we require a copy of your criminal record. We do that to ensure that we remain a trusted service provider and partner as well as to comply with relevant compliance requirements such as ISO27001.

Title: Slack App Developer
Description:
Experience: 8 - 20 Years

Location: Anywhere in the World Permanent Remote

Contract Duration: 6 - 12 Months

Opportunity- Full time Contract(8hrs in total) - 5 hours (PST overlap)

Total years of exp: 8-12 years

Mandatory Skills: 3+ Yrs - SaaS and Slack, Python and AWS - 3yrs, Slack Admin, Slack Workflows, Slack Forms, Slack APPs and APIs

Job Requirements


Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
Minimum of 3+ years of relevant experience with SaaS and Slack
Knowledge of digital workplace tools, specifically Slack Admin, Slack Workflows, Slack Forms, Slack APPs, and APIs
Strong grasp of Python and AWS
Expertise in configuration and integration using tools like PowerShell, JavaScript, Postman, etc.
Proficiency with web services/RESTful APIs
Strongholds in databases, including knowledge of SQL and NoSQL models


Job Responsibilities


Build and customize Slack and other collaboration workspaces
Identify the gaps between current and desired end-states of Slack and plan solutions
Improve collaboration and SaaS integrations to ensure consistent performance of the app
Support and escalate points for technical issues and resolve Slack escalation queues
Assist with delivery management processes and enforcement
Offer trainings of all Slack, custom Slack apps, workflow, and other digital workplace tools


Preferred Skills


Familiarity with networking and internet protocols, including TCP/IP, DNS, SMTP, HTTP, and distributed networks
Understanding of cloud security models and API security models
Practical knowledge of SDLC, ITIL, and Agile Frameworks
Experience working in an Agile environment
Good interpersonal and communication skills


Skills: apps,cloud security,slack apps,aws,app,powershell,slack forms,saas,apis,slack,nosql,slack admin,sql,api security,slack workflows,web services,sdlc,javascript,postman,python,restful apis,itil,agile

Title: Development Engineer
Place: Kolding, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Development Engineer for Sensing & Control

About Us

Every day, we get opportunities to make a positive impact – on our colleagues, partners, customers and society. Together, we’re pioneering the solutions of the future and unlocking the full potential of precious resources. Trusted to act on initiative, we challenge conventional thinking to develop world-leading technologies that inspire progress in vital areas, including energy, food, water and shipping.

As we push forward, the innovative, open spirit that fuels our 140-year-old start-up culture and rapid growth also drives our personal growth. So, as we shape a more resourceful, less wasteful world, we build our careers too.

About The Job

Are you our new colleague who will further strengthen our department and take our market leading products to the next level? To support our ambitions around digitalization and connectivity, we are looking for a proactive Mechatronic Engineer to drive the continued development of our current portfolio of Sensing & Control products.

Sensing & Control is a part of the R&D department within the business unit Hygienic Fluid Handling, where we develop our strong portfolio of fluid handling products like valves, pumps, cleaning and mixing. In the Sensing & Control team we are responsible for developing and maintaining mechatronic products and we have an ambition to expand our portfolio in the future. You will have a high degree of freedom in your daily work and experienced colleagues to support you. Reporting to Global Development Manager, the main purpose of this position is to maintain and development of our current portfolio of Sensing & Control products.

Your Responsibility Is To


Keep the products competitive in the market by continuous product enhancements and upgrades based on customer feedback.
Interaction with stakeholders across the full value chain, both internally and externally.
Improving the products from idea to implementation in design and manufacturing.
Test and validation in our “state of the art” test facilities.


The position is based in Kolding, Denmark. Up to 10-20 international travel days a year must be expected.

We offer an opportunity to be part of a strong international company with high and realistic growth ambitions. You will get a chance to use your experience within electronics, mechanics, pneumatics, plastic, assembly methods and product development. Furthermore, you will be able to be hands-on with new product development, use your creativity to solve tasks as well as interact with a wide range of colleagues and suppliers across the world. We offer state of the art test facilities on site and the opportunity to have close customer interactions in terms of client visits.

Who are you?

As a person you are result oriented, have an analytical as well as a focused approach to your work and is energized by working agile. You proactively seek solutions in a professional manner and characterize yourself as cooperative and communicative.

What you know?

You have a strong technical background within the fields of electrical and mechanic engineering. You have experience with product development, your background could be Mechatronic Engineer, Mechanical Engineer, or other relevant background.

If you have experience with mechatronic, automation, pneumatic, plastic parts and assembly it will be a benefit. You know how to find and solve problems in a structured manner using tools like Lean DMAIC. You are used to cooperation with sub-suppliers when it comes to technical demands and problem solving.

Our products are used within the food/pharma industry thus knowledge about equipment for these industries would be an advantage.

Due to the scope of the position, you are fluent in Danish and English both written and verbally.

For Questions Please Contact

For further information please contact Global development Manager Keld Bak at +45 28 95 57 72.

Please send your application and CV in one single document and in English, through the link below no later than 15th of January 2025. We are conducting a continuous review of received applications. We do not accept applications via email, due to General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).

We care about diversity, inclusion and equity in our recruitment processes. We also believe behavioral traits can provide important insights into a candidate's fit to a role. To help us achieve this we apply Pymetrics assessments, and upon application you will be invited to play the assessment games.

As part of our commitment to maintaining a safe and secure workplace, we conduct background checks on final candidates for this role.


Show more

Title: Coders - AI Training [Remote]
Description:
* Swift, Python, Java, Go, Verilog, Javascript, C++, or C# coding experience required




This is a great opportunity to supplement your income while looking for longer or more full-time work, all while contributing to the development of new AI models using your domain expertise!

Our client has hired over 1,000 Braintrust talent and intends to hire hundreds more!

Many Braintrust coders earn over $12,000 per month!




You’ll have the flexibility to work as much or as little as you choose - 20hrs/week is suggested, but not a limit. Start working in as little as 48 hours. Your final hourly rate will be chosen by Outlier AI and determined by your location.




What to expect: If qualified, you’ll be invited to complete a brief questionnaire that takes 3-5 minutes. If you successfully pass the questionnaire, you’ll be approved and able to begin work ASAP.




Required qualifications:

Proficiency working one of the following languages: Swift, Python, Java, Go, Verilog, Javascript, C++, or C#

Complete fluency in the English language is required. You should be able to describe code and abstract information in a clear way.




Preferred qualifications:

Bachelor's and/or Master's degree in Computer Science or equivalent. Students are welcome.




Note: Outlier AI is partnering with Remotasks for this opportunity

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Er du passioneret omkring data og machine learning? Vil du være med til at designe og implementere end-to-end data science løsninger? Har du erfaring med at træne og optimere machine learning modeller samt sætte dem i produktion? Så er du måske vores nye kollega!

Om stillingen

I Sund & Bælt søger vi en senior data scientist med solid erfaring indenfor machine learning og idriftsættelse af datadrevne løsninger heriblandt opsætning af data flows og pipelines. Du vil få mulighed for at arbejde med teknologier som NLP, generativ AI, billedgenkendelse og meget mere, samt mulighed for at være med til at præge og drive Sund & Bælts AI tiltag.

Arbejdsopgaver

En del af opgaver kan være:


Hjælpe de forskellige afdelinger med at omsætte deres problemstillinger til konkrete analyse- eller machine learning projekter.
Udvikle machine learning modeller.
Analysere og bearbejde struktureret og ustruktureret data fra mange forskellige datakilder, der spænder fra tekstdata og sensordata til geografisk data og billeddata.
Vedligeholde og gentræne modeller.
Udvikle services til udstilling af modeller og analyser via enten webapp eller API’er.
Idriftsætte færdige løsninger via Infrastructure as Code på Azure platformen.
Være med til at sætte rammerne for AI udvikling hos Sund & Bælt, samt forme og vedligeholde standarder.


Hvem er du

Vi forestiller os at du:


Er Flydende indenfor Python og har kendskab til SQL.
Har en relevant videregående uddannelse indenfor software udvikling, data science eller anden teknisk uddannelse.
Har min. 5 års relevant erhververfaring
Har bredt kendskab til supervised og unsupervised machine learning algoritmer.
Har hands-on erfaring med dataanalyse, statistik og machine learning.
Har kendskab til og erfaring med git.
Kan formidle og visualisere teknisk arbejde.
Kender til Docker eller lignende containerization teknologier.
Erfaring med at idriftsætte løsninger i cloud, gerne Azure.
Er god til og kan lide at kommunikere.
Kan arbejde selvstændigt på projekter.
Er god til at tilegne dig ny viden.
Kan lide at indgå i samarbejde med både tekniske- og forretningsorienterede kollegaer.


Din kommende arbejdsplads

Du bliver en del af afdelingen Applied Knowledge & AI i divisionen Digital. Afdelingen er nystartet, så det er vigtigt at du trives i en kontekst hvor du sammen med dine kollegaerer med til at sætte rammerne for hvordan vi arbejder med AI

Teamet består af data scientists, data engineers og forretningsudviklingsprofiler, som arbejder tæt sammen for at udvikle og implementere dataløsninger, der kan hjælpe forretningen med at optimere udviklingen, driften og vedligeholdelsen af vores infrastrukturanlæg.

Du får en arbejdsplads med god energi, god omgangstone, og fleksibel arbejdstid, da det er vigtigt for os, at privatliv og arbejdsliv fungerer godt – der er ligeledes gode muligheder for faglig og personlig udvikling.

Dit primære arbejdssted vil være i Vester Søgade i hjertet af København. Der vil være begrænset rejseaktivitet til vores kontorer i Halsskov og Rødby.

Lyder det som noget for dig?

Så vil vi meget gerne høre fra dig også hvis du ikke kan genkende dig selv i alle de ønskede faglige kvalifikationer.

Ansættelsesprocessen består af en første samtale, og for de kandidater som går videre vil der til anden samtale også være en kodetest

Skulle du have spørgsmål

omkring stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte Mie Hvas på tlf. 21 80 59 52.

Send din ansøgning og cv, så vi har den senest den 12. januar 2025
Show more
