Title: Software Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Can you picture yourself shaping the future of how LEGO creates our signature exciting presentation of our products?

Join our highly collaborative team to explore opportunities where LEGO products are digitally presented and bring your engineering experience into play so our content eco-system is evolved into the future Product Experience/Information Management (PXM/PIM).

We have identified a huge potential in how we present products for various purposes and channels. Therefore, we are changing the way we think about commercial content and how it is activated in all the situations where our users experience LEGO products. In short, we have enormous amounts of great content to show, and we have plenty ofinteraction points with users. What we need, is to change how we select, optimize and feed the best product presentation content for the specific purpose.

To achieve this, we’re expanding our team and seeking a passionate Software Engineer who can meet high business expectations with innovative technical solutions.

No relocation assistance is offered for this position.


Core Responsibilities

As we implement our new PXM/PIM platform into existing workflows, we anticipate various challenges and opportunities - some we’ve identified, others we’ll discover along the way.

We will define data models, integrate with existing systems, optimize processes with end users, analyze data, and innovate our approach to “content". You’ll join a team with a great foundation and growing demand for solutions, setting you up for success.

You'll play a key role in the team that both owns current automation and drives the change with a new platform. While investing in a new modern platform for the area, success requires seamless integration with internal systems under development and supporting workflow evolution in our commercial branches.

Your responsibilities will go beyond coding phenomenal APIs and building robust data integrations. You’ll connect with our users, understanding their challenges to deliver impactful solutions. This role demands technical expertise, user empathy, a practical attitude, and belief in our vision.

Play your part in our team succeeding

The Partner Experience Area is part of our mission to deliver the best digital experience for commercial partners. We focus on establishing global standards for content creation, curation, and optimization, enabling data-driven decisions, reducing manual workarounds, and presenting LEGO products in the best possible way across all digital channels. The tools we provide makes a huge difference to the people in our commercial offices around the world and in digital teamsbuilding engaging applications.

Join our Copenhagen-based Product Experience/Information Management team, collaborating closely with colleagues in Billund, London, Boston, Shanghai, and beyond. We work three days a week in the office, balancing focus time and team collaboration. Our culture is built around playful interaction and teamwork.

A typical day could involve pair programming with a teammate to implement a new feature, diving into a workshop to design an integration pattern, or reviewing pull requests. You could also be exploring ways to address data issues or brainstorming with our commercial partners to streamline workflows. Every day offers variety, impact, and opportunities to collaborate.

Our department typically relies on the following tools, languages and technologies (all in a backend context) Typescript, Node.js, (introducing Go), AWS (CDK, Lambda, EventBridge, SQS, SNS, etc), Elastic/Elasticsearch & some rational databases. Expect also to be working with Akeneo PIM. We like to build exciting things with boring technology but value a no-fuss best tool for a particular task.

While we are currently looking to strengthen the PXM/PIM team there will be opportunities to join other teams down the road, ensuring flexibility and supporting your personal growth. Collaboration is key to our success. As part of a team, you’ll align with others, communicate daily, and share knowledge to ensure transparency. Together we strive to be one team, helping and supporting each other to achieve extraordinary things, together.

Do you have what it takes?

You love building great products as part of a team and empowering and mentoring others. Teaching your skills and approaches comes naturally to you, and you’re always open to learning in return. As a problem solver, you focus on crafting the best solution, tackling technical challenges, and ensuring all requirements are met and delivered.

Furthermore, you'll do well in this role if you





Have experience building distributed cloud systems at scale, using infrastructure-as-code, event driven principles, and our tech stack.
Have worked with Product Information/Experience Management, Master Data Management, or similar systems related to commercial product content.
Bring solid API design and system integration expertise, with a proven ability to articulate and deliver solutions.
Understand security in web-based solutions and APIs.
Know CI/CD workflows, e.g. GitHub Actions, and advocate automation.
Excel at evolving existing systems into next-generation services, not just greenfield development.
Are flexible and open to working with different product teams when needed, adapting to new challenges and contributing where your expertise can make the greatest impact.
You have excellent spoken and written English skills.




It wouldn’t hurt if you knew about





Operating high-performance applications and services in the AWS cloud.
Familiarity with React.js and GraphQL.
Experience with data mining on large datasets. ML tools and techniques.
DevOps experience.
Building distributed systems using microservice architecture.
Providing digital solutions for a retail-related domain.
Open-Source contribution experience is a plus.




Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

Research shows that women and people from different underrepresented backgrounds often only apply for a job if they meet 100% of the listed qualifications. If you dream of being a part of our team and you meet many, but not all of our listed qualifications for this role, please apply.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.
Show more
HTML:
Job Description

Can you picture yourself shaping the future of how LEGO creates our signature exciting presentation of our products?

Join our highly collaborative team to explore opportunities where LEGO products are digitally presented and bring your engineering experience into play so our content eco-system is evolved into the future Product Experience/Information Management (PXM/PIM).

We have identified a huge potential in how we present products for various purposes and channels. Therefore, we are changing the way we think about commercial content and how it is activated in all the situations where our users experience LEGO products. In short, we have enormous amounts of great content to show, and we have plenty ofinteraction points with users. What we need, is to change how we select, optimize and feed the best product presentation content for the specific purpose.

To achieve this, we’re expanding our team and seeking a passionate Software Engineer who can meet high business expectations with innovative technical solutions.

No relocation assistance is offered for this position.


Core Responsibilities

As we implement our new PXM/PIM platform into existing workflows, we anticipate various challenges and opportunities - some we’ve identified, others we’ll discover along the way.

We will define data models, integrate with existing systems, optimize processes with end users, analyze data, and innovate our approach to “content". You’ll join a team with a great foundation and growing demand for solutions, setting you up for success.

You'll play a key role in the team that both owns current automation and drives the change with a new platform. While investing in a new modern platform for the area, success requires seamless integration with internal systems under development and supporting workflow evolution in our commercial branches.

Your responsibilities will go beyond coding phenomenal APIs and building robust data integrations. You’ll connect with our users, understanding their challenges to deliver impactful solutions. This role demands technical expertise, user empathy, a practical attitude, and belief in our vision.

Play your part in our team succeeding

The Partner Experience Area is part of our mission to deliver the best digital experience for commercial partners. We focus on establishing global standards for content creation, curation, and optimization, enabling data-driven decisions, reducing manual workarounds, and presenting LEGO products in the best possible way across all digital channels. The tools we provide makes a huge difference to the people in our commercial offices around the world and in digital teamsbuilding engaging applications.

Join our Copenhagen-based Product Experience/Information Management team, collaborating closely with colleagues in Billund, London, Boston, Shanghai, and beyond. We work three days a week in the office, balancing focus time and team collaboration. Our culture is built around playful interaction and teamwork.

A typical day could involve pair programming with a teammate to implement a new feature, diving into a workshop to design an integration pattern, or reviewing pull requests. You could also be exploring ways to address data issues or brainstorming with our commercial partners to streamline workflows. Every day offers variety, impact, and opportunities to collaborate.

Our department typically relies on the following tools, languages and technologies (all in a backend context) Typescript, Node.js, (introducing Go), AWS (CDK, Lambda, EventBridge, SQS, SNS, etc), Elastic/Elasticsearch & some rational databases. Expect also to be working with Akeneo PIM. We like to build exciting things with boring technology but value a no-fuss best tool for a particular task.

While we are currently looking to strengthen the PXM/PIM team there will be opportunities to join other teams down the road, ensuring flexibility and supporting your personal growth. Collaboration is key to our success. As part of a team, you’ll align with others, communicate daily, and share knowledge to ensure transparency. Together we strive to be one team, helping and supporting each other to achieve extraordinary things, together.

Do you have what it takes?

You love building great products as part of a team and empowering and mentoring others. Teaching your skills and approaches comes naturally to you, and you’re always open to learning in return. As a problem solver, you focus on crafting the best solution, tackling technical challenges, and ensuring all requirements are met and delivered.

Furthermore, you'll do well in this role if you



  • Have experience building distributed cloud systems at scale, using infrastructure-as-code, event driven principles, and our tech stack.
  • Have worked with Product Information/Experience Management, Master Data Management, or similar systems related to commercial product content.
  • Bring solid API design and system integration expertise, with a proven ability to articulate and deliver solutions.
  • Understand security in web-based solutions and APIs.
  • Know CI/CD workflows, e.g. GitHub Actions, and advocate automation.
  • Excel at evolving existing systems into next-generation services, not just greenfield development.
  • Are flexible and open to working with different product teams when needed, adapting to new challenges and contributing where your expertise can make the greatest impact.
  • You have excellent spoken and written English skills.



It wouldn’t hurt if you knew about



  • Operating high-performance applications and services in the AWS cloud.
  • Familiarity with React.js and GraphQL.
  • Experience with data mining on large datasets. ML tools and techniques.
  • DevOps experience.
  • Building distributed systems using microservice architecture.
  • Providing digital solutions for a retail-related domain.
  • Open-Source contribution experience is a plus.

Title: Full stack developer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Fullstack Software Developer for international SaaS product




Mouseflow is growing rapidly, securing our position as the strongest provider of digital- and user experience analytics for customers all around the world.

For our development team in the center of Copenhagen, we’re now hiring talented Software Developers.

As a developer you become part of an agile, cross-functional scrum team in R&D, working closely with other R&D functions like Product Management and Data Science, strengthening and enhancing a product that is already market leading in the field of user experience analytics and conversions.




Job contents

You will focus most of your time on building great functionality with a dedicated team of motivated and skilled professionals.
We strive to deliver clean, flexible code across the full stack and we value new ideas and discussions about continuously improving our quality and maintainability.
We keep the tech stack of the Mouseflow core product relevant and up-to-date, and C#/.NET, JavaScript, and Vue.js are the most important technologies in our toolbox right now.
You will get influence on the analysis and design work driven by product management and help ensure good solutions that are robust and maintenance-friendly.
In addition to the development team, you will work with the product department, the business feature owners, the UX designers and other fantastic colleagues to ensure that we provide real value for our users across the world on every roll-out.




Requirements

Relevant theoretical background in software design and methodologies.
Proven track-record in developing complex end-user systems using both JavaScript and C#/.NET, and being part of a cross-functional scrum team.
Can-do attitude and excellent problem-solving skills.
Team spirit, and a desire to take responsibility and invest your talent in Mouseflow’s continued growth and success.




Benefits

Work with colleagues across all departments in an international organization that thrives without unnecessary hierarchy or bureaucracy.
Be part of a company which believes that the right, dedicated talent is the foundation for success.
Be part of an informal culture where your colleagues across the globe know who you are, and where everybody from student worker to CEO is only a Slack message away.
Work from our SOHO office in the best location in central Copenhagen’s old meatpacking district – a 10 minutes’ walk from Copenhagen central station




In this role, you will report to the CTO. This position is a great opportunity for someone with a few years of experience, looking to accelerate their career at a fast-growing enterprise SaaS company with a sustainable growth mindset and substantial market recognition.




For more information about the job, please feel free to contact our HR & Talent acquisition Partner Marlene de Voss at mv@mouseflow.com




Apply

Please send your resume/CV via Linkedin.

As we interview candidates continuously, we kindly ask you to send your application as soon as possible.




About Mouseflow

Mouseflow is one of the most successful software companies in web analytics, developing innovative software since 2009. In 2018, Offspring Capital acquired Mouseflow with the clear strategy of taking Mouseflow to the next level. Mouseflow is growing fast and gaining broad recognition in the market. It was recently recognized in the G2 list of Top 100 Software Products, across all industries. And it has received the coveted Børsen Gazelle award 6 times in a row, recognizing its place among the fastest growing companies in Denmark.

Our team is distributed between our offices in Copenhagen, Denmark and Austin, Texas. We serve more than 210,000 customers in 100+ countries. Our customers consist of the world’s biggest brands and our users range from entry-level associates to Directors in Marketing, Product, Analytics, UX, and CRO teams.

Show more

Title: Senior Researcher in Structural Digitalization and Non-Destructive Testing (NDT) of Composite Structures - DTU Wind
Description:
Job Description

Is your dream job to do research in structural modeling using cutting-edge digital technologies? Then the new scientist position at DTU might be what you are looking for. The position will strengthen the department’s research in structural digitization and nondestructive testing (NDT) of wind turbine structural components, such as composite wind turbine blades.

Responsibilities And Qualifications

You are expected to work on the following topics:


Develop the key enabling technologies to enhance the accuracy and efficiency of structural digital representation focusing on structural damage and failure assessment
Use NDT equipment to characterize damage state in composite materials and structures
Development of NDT procedures to be used at various test set-ups in laboratories
Writing papers for international scientific journals
Development of numerical tools to create research impact on the wind energy industry
Development of research projects, writing project applications to acquire external funding
Teach and supervise MSc students and thesis projects
Supervise/co-supervise PhD-students
Guide and supervise assistant professors and researchers
Innovation and collaboration with industry


Preference will be given to applicants that can document:


Successful funding acquisition and project management
Publications in the field of NDT of composite materials and/or structures
Experience in the use of one or more NDT techniques, e.g., thermography, ultrasound scanning, acoustic emission, and X-ray tomography.
Experience in leadership in the research context
Experience in experimental work such as using sensor technologies
Experience in state-of-the-art digital technologies such as machine learning
Ability to work with other researchers, engineers, and technicians


You must be responsible for the teaching of courses. DTU employs two working languages: Danish and English. You are expected to be fluent in at least one of these languages, and in time are expected to master both.

As a formal qualification you must hold a PhD degree (or equivalent) as well as academic qualifications equivalent to those obtained by holding a position as a researcher or postdoc. To be appointed as a senior researcher, you must have completed a didactic/pedagogic education. If you do not have the necessary education, then it is possible to complete this requirement within a period of two years of appointment.

You will be assessed against the responsibilities and qualifications stated above and the following general criteria:


Research experience
Experience and quality of teaching
Research vision and potential
International impact and experience
Societal impact
Innovativeness, including commercialization and collaboration with industry
Leadership, collaboration, and interdisciplinary skills
Communication skills


Salary and terms of employment

The appointment will be based on the collective agreement with the Danish Confederation of Professional Associations. The allowance will be agreed upon with the relevant union.

The starting date of the position is March 1, 2025, or according to the agreement. The position is a permanent position.

You can read more about career paths at DTU here .

You can read more about DTU career path for Senior Researchers at https://www.dtu.dk/english/about/job-and-career/working-at-dtu/career-paths/associate-professor-senior-researcher

Further information

Further information may be obtained from Xiao Chen (xiac@dtu.dk), Associate Professor, Head of Section, Structure Virtual Testing and Digitalization and Ignacio Marti (imarti@dtu.dk), Head of Division of Wind Energy Materials and Components at the Department of Wind and Energy Systems.

You can read more about DTU Wind and Energy Systems at www.vindenergi.dtu.dk/english

You can read more about Section of Structural Virtual Testing and Digitalization at https://wind.dtu.dk/research/research-divisions/materials-and-components/structural-virtual-testing-and-digitalization

If you are applying from abroad, you may find useful information on working in Denmark and at DTU at DTU – Moving to Denmark .

Application procedure

Please submit your online application no later than 30 January 2025 (23:59 Danish time).

Applications must be submitted as one PDF file containing all materials to be given consideration. To apply, please open the link "Apply now", fill out the online application form, and attach all your materials in English in one PDF file. The file must include:


Application (cover letter)
Vision for teaching and research
CV including employment history, list of publications indicating scientific highlights, H-index and ORCID (see http://orcid.org/ )
Teaching portfolio including documentation of teaching experience
Academic Diplomas (MSc/PhD)
Contact information of two persons for references


You can learn more about the recruitment process here .

Applications received after the deadline will not be considered.

All interested candidates irrespective of age, gender, disability, race, religion or ethnic background are encouraged to apply. As DTU works with research in critical technology, which is subject to special rules for security and export control, open-source background checks may be conducted on qualified candidates for the position.

DTU Wind and Energy Systems is organized in 4 divisions and 20 sections. The organizational set-up reflects the new role of wind power in the energy systems as well as the continued need for development of new wind turbine technology and materials and components research. 1 March 2022, DTU Wind Energy merged with Centre for Electric Power and Energy (CEE) and became Department of Wind and Energy Systems. DTU Wind and Energy Systems is organized in 4 divisions and 20 sections. The organizational set-up reflects the new role of wind power in the energy systems as well as the continued need for development of new wind turbine technology and materials and components research.

Technology for people

DTU develops technology for people. With our international elite research and study programmes, we are helping to create a better world and to solve the global challenges formulated in the UN’s 17 Sustainable Development Goals. Hans Christian Ørsted founded DTU in 1829 with a clear mission to develop and create value using science and engineering to benefit society. That mission lives on today. DTU has 13,500 students and 6,000 employees. We work in an international atmosphere and have an inclusive, evolving, and informal working environment. DTU has campuses in all parts of Denmark and in Greenland, and we collaborate with the best universities around the world.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer (back-end)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Hos KMD udvikler vi digitale løsninger, som bruges og skaber fremskridt for millioner af mennesker verden over. Disse løsninger danner digitalt grundlag for samfundets vigtigste aktører, fra politiske og juridiske myndigheder og offentlige instanser til finansielle institutioner og private virksomheder. Vores mission er at gøre deres digitale ydelser og adfærd pålidelig, tilgængelig og effektiv.




Vi tror på, at fremtiden er, hvad du selv gør den til. Derfor er en karriere hos KMD en karriere med formål og frihed. Her er du ikke alene direkte medvirkende til at forbedre livet og hverdagen for en masse mennesker. Du får også motivation, plads og værktøjer til at forme din egen professionelle færd og udvikling.




Brænder du for at arbejde med data engineering via data-warehouse, BI og advanced analytics, på cloud og on-premise teknologi? Får du energi af at levere løsninger der skaber konkret værdi hos brugeren? Vil du være med til at sætte den tekniske retning?




Som vores nye kollega er du med til at sikre vores kunder det bedst mulige fundament for datadrevne beslutninger. Du bliver en del af et team og en kultur, hvor vi udvikler løsninger i tæt samspil med vores kunder. Vores tilgang i samarbejdet er transparens, ærlighed, og ordentlighed.







Om jobbet




Vores ambition at blive Danmarks fortrukne rådgiver- og udviklingspartner indenfor Data og Advanced Analytics. Vores udviklingsrejse er bakket op af KMD, NEC og Charlie Tango.

Du vil komme til at arbejde i fagligt fællesskab med 25+kollegaer, hvor fokus er at levere værdiskabende løsninger og have langvarige kunderelationer. Ledelsesstilen er åben og inkluderende, med en tydelig forventning til alle om at sætte deres aftryk.




Teamet du ansættes hos, er fordelt på Østerbro i København, Aarhus og Aalborg.







Arbejdsopgaver




Deltager i behovsafklaringer fx sammen med forretningsspecialister hos vores kunder
Tager ejerskab for videreudvikling og vedligeholdelse af eksisterende løsninger (on-premise og cloud)
Understøtter anvendelsen- og videreudviklingen af vores teknologiske løsninger
Bidrager i udarbejdelse af tilbud og udbud – Vi er alle en del af projekterne fra start til slut




Som konsulent tager du ansvar for dine opgaver og sætter retning sammen med dine kollegaer. Det vigtigste for os er, at du kan afdække krav, kode og implementere løsningerne.







Om dig




Du er typen der sætter en ære i at forstå og finde løsninger på komplekse problemer. Som konsulent er du først og fremmest proaktiv og løsningsorienteret med et solidt teknisk fundament. Du er struktureret, detaljeorienteret og analytisk i din opgaveløsning og fastholder samtidigt overblikket. Du er teknisk sparringspartner og omsætter teknisk viden til værdi for kundens forretning. Ansvar og samarbejde falder dig naturligt og du ikke bange for at sige din mening. Du synes, at det er spændende at følge en opgave hele vejen fra idéfase over design til implementering.




Da vi ikke har sælgere ansat, er det vigtigt at alle deltager i at skabe nye opgaver, kunder og projekter. Det er derfor vigtigt at du ser dig selv som mere end udvikler - Du er konsulent




Vi forestiller os at du har følgende kvalifikationer:




Relevant uddannelse kombineret med teknisk-erfaring (3+ års erfaring som MS full-stack BI/DW udvikler)
Kendskab til versionsstyring og databaseprojekter i Visual Studio / SVN / GIT
Dygtig indenfor ETL, datamodellering, databaser og optimering af SQL
Erfaring med en eller flere af disse Azure Data-stack, Databricks, MS Fabric og Snowflake




Vi forventer, at du har flere års erfaring med at udvikle og vedligeholde dataplatform-løsninger end-to-end, dog er du klart stærkest på back-end-delen. Optimalt set har du erfaring fra både on-premise- og cloudbaserede løsninger, hvorfra du medbringer erfaring med meta-drevet frameworks, moderne BI-arkitektur og forståelse for kundens forretningsværdi.




Du er flydende på dansk og engelsk, både mundtligt og skriftligt.




Vi tilbyder




Som vores nye kollega tilbyder vi dig:

Frie rammer, hvor der er plads til familie, venner og hobbyer.
Et arbejdsmiljø baseret på høj tillid; vi stoler på hinanden og løfter i fællesskab.
Indflydelse på hverdagen og vores vej mod målet, vi tror på at medindflydelse gør jobbet sjovere.
En anerkendende arbejdskultur hvor det er tilladt at fejle. Vi betragter fejl som læringsmuligheder.




Du bliver ansat på baggrund af den du er, din erfaring og det du brænder for. Din titel og løn bestemmes ud fra dine kvalifikationer.







Vil du vide mere?




Hvis det lyder som noget for dig, så tøv ikke med at kontakte CDO Simon Bøggild Schmidt på +45 9137 5655 for at høre nærmere om stillingen.

Send din motiverede ansøgning og dit CV af sted allerede i dag, idet vi løbende afholder ansættelsessamtaler. Seneste frist for ansøgning er søndag den 9. februar.







KMD (an NEC company) is committed to providing equal opportunities. Hence, we invite all qualified interested applicants to apply for career opportunities. At KMD all aspects of employment and cooperation including the decision to hire/cooperate with will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or any other status protected under local anti-discrimination legislation.

Copyright KMD 2024(C)

Show more
HTML:
Hos KMD udvikler vi digitale løsninger, som bruges og skaber fremskridt for millioner af mennesker verden over. Disse løsninger danner digitalt grundlag for samfundets vigtigste aktører, fra politiske og juridiske myndigheder og offentlige instanser til finansielle institutioner og private virksomheder. Vores mission er at gøre deres digitale ydelser og adfærd pålidelig, tilgængelig og effektiv.


Vi tror på, at fremtiden er, hvad du selv gør den til. Derfor er en karriere hos KMD en karriere med formål og frihed. Her er du ikke alene direkte medvirkende til at forbedre livet og hverdagen for en masse mennesker. Du får også motivation, plads og værktøjer til at forme din egen professionelle færd og udvikling.


Brænder du for at arbejde med data engineering via data-warehouse, BI og advanced analytics, på cloud og on-premise teknologi? Får du energi af at levere løsninger der skaber konkret værdi hos brugeren? Vil du være med til at sætte den tekniske retning?


Som vores nye kollega er du med til at sikre vores kunder det bedst mulige fundament for datadrevne beslutninger. Du bliver en del af et team og en kultur, hvor vi udvikler løsninger i tæt samspil med vores kunder. Vores tilgang i samarbejdet er transparens, ærlighed, og ordentlighed.



Om jobbet


Vores ambition at blive Danmarks fortrukne rådgiver- og udviklingspartner indenfor Data og Advanced Analytics. Vores udviklingsrejse er bakket op af KMD, NEC og Charlie Tango.

Du vil komme til at arbejde i fagligt fællesskab med 25+kollegaer, hvor fokus er at levere værdiskabende løsninger og have langvarige kunderelationer. Ledelsesstilen er åben og inkluderende, med en tydelig forventning til alle om at sætte deres aftryk.


Teamet du ansættes hos, er fordelt på Østerbro i København, Aarhus og Aalborg.



Arbejdsopgaver


  • Deltager i behovsafklaringer fx sammen med forretningsspecialister hos vores kunder
  • Tager ejerskab for videreudvikling og vedligeholdelse af eksisterende løsninger (on-premise og cloud)
  • Understøtter anvendelsen- og videreudviklingen af vores teknologiske løsninger
  • Bidrager i udarbejdelse af tilbud og udbud – Vi er alle en del af projekterne fra start til slut


Som konsulent tager du ansvar for dine opgaver og sætter retning sammen med dine kollegaer. Det vigtigste for os er, at du kan afdække krav, kode og implementere løsningerne.



Om dig


Du er typen der sætter en ære i at forstå og finde løsninger på komplekse problemer. Som konsulent er du først og fremmest proaktiv og løsningsorienteret med et solidt teknisk fundament. Du er struktureret, detaljeorienteret og analytisk i din opgaveløsning og fastholder samtidigt overblikket. Du er teknisk sparringspartner og omsætter teknisk viden til værdi for kundens forretning. Ansvar og samarbejde falder dig naturligt og du ikke bange for at sige din mening. Du synes, at det er spændende at følge en opgave hele vejen fra idéfase over design til implementering.


Da vi ikke har sælgere ansat, er det vigtigt at alle deltager i at skabe nye opgaver, kunder og projekter. Det er derfor vigtigt at du ser dig selv som mere end udvikler - Du er konsulent


Vi forestiller os at du har følgende kvalifikationer:


  • Relevant uddannelse kombineret med teknisk-erfaring (3+ års erfaring som MS full-stack BI/DW udvikler)
  • Kendskab til versionsstyring og databaseprojekter i Visual Studio / SVN / GIT
  • Dygtig indenfor ETL, datamodellering, databaser og optimering af SQL
  • Erfaring med en eller flere af disse Azure Data-stack, Databricks, MS Fabric og Snowflake


Vi forventer, at du har flere års erfaring med at udvikle og vedligeholde dataplatform-løsninger end-to-end, dog er du klart stærkest på back-end-delen. Optimalt set har du erfaring fra både on-premise- og cloudbaserede løsninger, hvorfra du medbringer erfaring med meta-drevet frameworks, moderne BI-arkitektur og forståelse for kundens forretningsværdi.


Du er flydende på dansk og engelsk, både mundtligt og skriftligt.


Vi tilbyder


Som vores nye kollega tilbyder vi dig:

  • Frie rammer, hvor der er plads til familie, venner og hobbyer.
  • Et arbejdsmiljø baseret på høj tillid; vi stoler på hinanden og løfter i fællesskab.
  • Indflydelse på hverdagen og vores vej mod målet, vi tror på at medindflydelse gør jobbet sjovere.
  • En anerkendende arbejdskultur hvor det er tilladt at fejle. Vi betragter fejl som læringsmuligheder.


Du bliver ansat på baggrund af den du er, din erfaring og det du brænder for. Din titel og løn bestemmes ud fra dine kvalifikationer.



Vil du vide mere?


Hvis det lyder som noget for dig, så tøv ikke med at kontakte CDO Simon Bøggild Schmidt på +45 9137 5655 for at høre nærmere om stillingen.

Send din motiverede ansøgning og dit CV af sted allerede i dag, idet vi løbende afholder ansættelsessamtaler. Seneste frist for ansøgning er søndag den 9. februar.

Title: Senior BI Specialist/Data Engineer
Description:
Vil du være omdrejningspunktet for en datadrevet IT-serviceorganisation, der drifter størstedelen af Danmarks økonomi? Så har du nu mulighed for at blive en del af JN Datas Business Intelligence team.




Stillingen

Vi er en af Nordens største IT-serviceorganisationer for den finansielle sektor i Norden og med flere vigtige kildesystemer, er det din og teamets opgave at sørge for, at vores organisation og kunder får det maksimale ud af deres datapotentiale.




I stillingen får du mulighed for at arbejde med og dygtiggøre dig inden for Microsofts BI-teknologier samt præge JN Datas anvendelse af teknologierne i fremtiden. Du kommer til at arbejde med dataprojekter, der understøtter forskellige domæner, fra klassiske supportfunktioner som økonomi til vores højt specialiserede IT-serviceområder, der satser stort på data, automatisering og kunstig intelligens. En stor del af tiden vil du derfor arbejde tæt sammen med forretningen om de forskellige leverancer.




Dine primære arbejdsopgaver bliver, at:

Videreudvikle og optimere vores datawarehouse-løsning og sikre integrationer til eksisterende og nye datakilder. Vores forretning tørster efter adgang til data på tværs af kilder, så du får en central funktion i, at det kan lade sig gøre på en effektiv og sikker måde.
Automatisere og optimere dataflows og databårne processer på tværs af organisationen, så vi får afviklet Excelark og manuelle datainput. Dette med henblik på at få skabt en enterprise-dataløsning, som hele forretningen på sigt kan tilgå til brug for analyse, automatisering og nye datadrevne services og koncepter.
Modellere data og forretningslogik, der muliggør rapportering og udstilling af data til vores interessenter på tværs af organisationen. Vi har allerede etableret grundlaget for en skalerbar og fremtidssikret datamodel, som du kommer til at være med til at vedligeholde og udvikle.
Forme og optimere dataarkitekturen, vores processer og vores teknologistak i samarbejde med dine kollegaer i BI-teamet. Vi er ved at tage de indledende skridt til at ibrugtage forskellige cloud-værktøjer, så du kan være med til at præge den fremtidige teknologi, vi anvender.




Teamet

Du bliver en del af vores voksende BI-team i Silkeborg, som sammen med øverste ledelse i JN Data har fokus på at fremme en betydelig datamodenhedsrejse.




Du får syv kollegaer og sparringspartnere i BI-teamet, 6 udviklere og en scrum master. Herudover arbejder vi tæt sammen med kollegaer indenfor it-arkitektur, processer, sikkerhed, compliance og kunstig intelligens, der sammen med os driver rejsen mod flere og bedre data – vi vil nemlig hele tiden gerne gøre det lidt bedre.




Dig

Du kan komme fra forskellige baggrunde job- og uddannelsesmæssigt. Det vigtigste er, at du er stærk på datamodellering og ETL-processer og generelt har interesse i og gode evner inden for IT. Du vil primært arbejde i vores back-end, men du har også interesse i at håndtere dataprojekter hele vejen fra kilde til færdig rapportering og dermed være full-stack udvikler i nogle sammenhænge. Herudover kan du sætte informationer fra dine interessenter i system og bruge det som fundament for at lave løsninger.




Vores BI-platform er baseret på Microsoft-teknologi, så det er nødvendigt, at du har erfaring med følgende teknologier/værktøjer:

PowerBI Premium og Tabular Editor
Microsoft SQL Server, herunder SSMS og SSIS
SQL og evt. Powershell
Visual Studio og Git/Bitbucket
Evt. Power Automate.




Du forstår at tilpasse din kommunikation til de forskellige interessenter, så budskabet er klart og tydeligt. Da du vil have både dansk- engelsktalende kollegaer, taler og skriver du flydende dansk og engelsk.




Hvad tilbyder vi?

Som medarbejder hos JN Data er du sikret nogle gode ansættelsesvilkår. Vi tilbyder bl.a. god pensionsordning, 6. ferieuge, 5 omsorgsdage, forhøjet ferietillæg, gruppelivsforsikring, sundhedssikring, tandforsikring og fuld løn under barsel.




Du bliver en del af et professionelt, men uformelt arbejdsmiljø, hvor der er stort fokus på medarbejdertrivsel og udvikling. Vi tilbyder vi fleksible arbejdstider og mulighed for hjemmearbejde.




Fangede vi din interesse?

Så ser vi frem til at høre fra dig. Hvis du har spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte Head of Data & Systems Architecture Lars Trier Husted på 61240213.

Show more

  • SQL og evt. Powershell

  • Evt. Power Automate.

Så ser vi frem til at høre fra dig. Hvis du har spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte Head of Data & Systems Architecture Lars Trier Husted på 61240213.

Title: Software Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Looking for a job where your coding skills are genuinely valued? A place where you can engage with innovative technology that makes a real difference on human health? Look no further! Join a space where creativity and efficiency are encouraged and essential. If you’re eager to shift from mundane tasks to groundbreaking technology and solving actual problems, we’d love to welcome you aboard.




About Us

We are an early-stage biotech startup based at the BioInnovation Institute (BII) in the beautiful city of Copenhagen. Our aim is to transform precision medicine through innovative spatial proteomics. Using our cutting-edge platform, we can study spatial protein expression at a single-cell level, providing novel insights into health and disease. We will enable data-driven precision therapies that radically improve patient outcomes. Curious? Our story can be traced back to the following paper1 and subsequent developments2 with recent real-life applications3.




We are a fun, ambitious group of scientists, engineers and entrepreneurs that are united by a mission. We believe the next generation of precision medicine will be unlocked by exceptional, creative and interdisciplinary minds, working side by side. If that’s you, read on!




The Role

As a Software Engineer at OmicVision, you will be instrumental in developing and maintaining our cloud-based data processing infrastructure. You will play a key role in planning and revising our cloud architecture, writing code to integrate various components, and implementing innovative dashboarding solutions to make our data more accessible and informative. As a seasoned coder, you will be the guiding star for domain experts, often from academic backgrounds, helping them translate their expertise into robust and effective code.




You will

Be given a lot of responsibility from Day 1, tackle many challenges, wear many hats and be involved in the earliest stages of a company
Design, plan, and revise cloud-based data architecture to ensure scalability, efficiency, and security.
Develop and maintain code to integrate different cloud services and data processing components. 
Implement dashboarding solutions to visualize data for easier interpretation and decision-making.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and deliver effective cloud-based solutions.
Stay updated with the latest cloud technologies and practices to improve our data processing infrastructure continuously.




You have

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology, or a related field with more than five years of industry experience.
Proven experience in cloud computing and data engineering.
Strong programming skills in languages such as Python, Java, or similar.
Experience with cloud services and infrastructure (AWS, GCP, Azure) and data pipelines such as Apache Airflow, or ClearML
Knowledge of data visualization and dashboarding tools.
Excellent problem-solving abilities, willingness to work on many projects and attention to detail.




Nice to have

Experience with big data technologies/workflows
Familiarity with machine learning concepts and tools.
Prior experience in healthcare or a related industry.




Interested?

Please send your resume and a short cover letter to jobs@omicvision.com, with “Software Engineer 42” in the subject line. Feel free to include any relevant portfolio links (e.g., GitHub repositories).

As a company, we care about your potential, not your background. If this role is exciting to you, don’t hesitate to apply. We welcome everyone regardless of your background – outstanding team players always stand out.

We review applications after the holidays and will schedule the first interviews in January. Look forward to hearing from you!




1 https://doi.org/10.1038/s41587-022-01302-5

2 https://doi.org/10.1038/s41592-023-02007-6

3 https://doi.org/10.1038/s41586-024-08061-0

Show more

Title: DevOps Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Sapiens is on the lookout for a DevOps Engineer to become a key player in our Denmark team. If you're a seasoned DevOps and ready to take your career to new heights with an established, globally successful company, this role could be the perfect fit.

Location: Lyngbyvej 2, Copenhagen, Denmark

Working Model: Hybrid




This position will be part of Sapiens’ P&C division .




What You’ll Do

Implement and manage continuous integration and deployment pipelines using Jenkins and other CI/CD tools.
Maintain and optimize Docker containers for efficient deployment and operation.
Monitor and troubleshoot Linux-based systems of shared R&D product instances.
Work closely with development teams to optimize application performance and troubleshoot issues.
Evaluate and recommend new tools, technologies, and methodologies to improve the efficiency and reliability of the DevOps processes.
Provide technical guidance and support to team members as needed.




What To Have For This Position

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Engineering, or related field (or equivalent experience).
Proficiency in Git for version control.
Experience with Jenkins or similar CI/CD tools for automated build, test, and deployment pipelines.
Proficiency in Docker for containerization and orchestration.
Understanding of Linux-based systems and shell scripting.
Familiarity with Kubernetes and Helm is a plus.
Excellent communication skills.
Ability to quickly learn new technologies and adapt to changing requirements.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
Fluent English.




Good To Have

Danish language knowledge would be a nice plus




What We Offer

Annual bonus
Pension contributions
Health care insurance that includes family as standard (after trial period)
Cell phone for a personal use
Internet allowance
DSB Travelcard (Bruttolon ordning) – before tax gets it,
Free snacks and breakfast at the office
Free fitness center in Vibenshuse
Hybrid working style
Social club




About Sapiens

Sapiens International Corporation (NASDAQ and TASE: SPNS) is a global leader in intelligent insurance software solutions. With Sapiens’ robust platform, customer-driven partnerships, and rich ecosystem, insurers are empowered to future-proof their organizations with operational excellence in a rapidly changing marketplace. We help insurers harness the power of AI and advanced automation to support core solutions for property and casualty, workers’ compensation, and life insurance, including reinsurance, financial & compliance, data & analytics, digital, and decision management. Sapiens boasts a longtime global presence, serving over 600 customers in more than 30 countries with its innovative SaaS offerings. Recognized by industry experts and selected for the Microsoft Top 100 Partner program, Sapiens is committed to partnering with our customers for their entire transformation journey and is continuously innovating to ensure their success. For more information visit us at www.sapiens.com.

Sapiens is an equal-opportunity employer. We value diversity and strive to create an inclusive work environment that embraces individuals from diverse backgrounds.

Show more

Location: Lyngbyvej 2, Copenhagen, Denmark

Working Model: Hybrid


This position will be part of Sapiens’ P&C division .


What You’ll Do

  • Implement and manage continuous integration and deployment pipelines using Jenkins and other CI/CD tools.
  • Maintain and optimize Docker containers for efficient deployment and operation.
  • Monitor and troubleshoot Linux-based systems of shared R&D product instances.
  • Work closely with development teams to optimize application performance and troubleshoot issues.
  • Evaluate and recommend new tools, technologies, and methodologies to improve the efficiency and reliability of the DevOps processes.
  • Provide technical guidance and support to team members as needed.


What To Have For This Position

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Engineering, or related field (or equivalent experience).
  • Proficiency in Git for version control.
  • Experience with Jenkins or similar CI/CD tools for automated build, test, and deployment pipelines.
  • Proficiency in Docker for containerization and orchestration.
  • Understanding of Linux-based systems and shell scripting.
  • Familiarity with Kubernetes and Helm is a plus.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Ability to quickly learn new technologies and adapt to changing requirements.
  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
  • Fluent English.


Good To Have

  • Danish language knowledge would be a nice plus


What We Offer

  • Annual bonus
  • Pension contributions
  • Health care insurance that includes family as standard (after trial period)
  • Cell phone for a personal use
  • Internet allowance
  • DSB Travelcard (Bruttolon ordning) – before tax gets it,
  • Free snacks and breakfast at the office
  • Free fitness center in Vibenshuse
  • Hybrid working style
  • Social club


About Sapiens

Sapiens International Corporation (NASDAQ and TASE: SPNS) is a global leader in intelligent insurance software solutions. With Sapiens’ robust platform, customer-driven partnerships, and rich ecosystem, insurers are empowered to future-proof their organizations with operational excellence in a rapidly changing marketplace. We help insurers harness the power of AI and advanced automation to support core solutions for property and casualty, workers’ compensation, and life insurance, including reinsurance, financial & compliance, data & analytics, digital, and decision management. Sapiens boasts a longtime global presence, serving over 600 customers in more than 30 countries with its innovative SaaS offerings. Recognized by industry experts and selected for the Microsoft Top 100 Partner program, Sapiens is committed to partnering with our customers for their entire transformation journey and is continuously innovating to ensure their success. For more information visit us at www.sapiens.com.

Sapiens is an equal-opportunity employer. We value diversity and strive to create an inclusive work environment that embraces individuals from diverse backgrounds.

Title: Senior Software Engineer - Observability Platform
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Join us in building an extraordinary observability platform and help us continue to encourage and develop the builders of tomorrow.

We seek an innovative software engineer to join our outstanding Observability Platform (OP) team of highly skilled engineers – Brave engineers with a mission to improve developer efficiency in our digital organization, so we can reach even more kids with a digital experience – and have an upbeat experience ourselves along the path!


Core Responsibilities

We are seeking an experienced and groundbreaking Senior Observability Platform Engineer. To take a leading role in the design, implementation and maintenance of a unified observability platform, ensuring seamless integration with existing tools and systems.





Collaborate with multi-functional teams and collaborators to understand observability needs and deliver tailored solutions that improve system visibility and performance.
Develop and implement standard methodologies for monitoring, logging, and alerting across the organization.
Drive automation initiatives to improve observability processes and reduce manual intervention.
Mentor and guide engineers, fostering a culture of learning and innovation.
Solve and resolve sophisticated issues related to observability systems and tools.
Stay align with industry trends and emerging technologies, driving improvements to our observability strategy and platform.




Play your part in our team succeeding

The position is part of the larger Developer Experience and Cloud Foundation area, providing product teams in the LEGO Group with foundational capabilities for developing, deploying, and operating IT solutions. As an engineer in OP, you will be part of a team that builds the next generation of our "developer experience and productivity platform".

In OP we strive to find the balance between reducing cognitive load with architecture guidelines and platforms and on the other side empowering developers to be in control of their code and architectures. This platform will integrate technologies like Prometheus, OpenTelemetry, Grafana, ELK, Zabbix, and PagerDuty, providing comprehensive observability services to all product teams within the LEGO Group. As a senior member of the team, this position will play a key role in shaping our observability strategy and ensuring our systems are reliable, scalable, and efficient.

The team is based in the new LEGO® Digital Office in Copenhagen, offering an exciting, inspiring, and flexible work environment – and a little fun play as well!

Do you have what it takes?

Preferably applicants for this role have several years of extensive experience in designing and managing observability platforms using Prometheus, OpenTelemetry, Grafana, ELK, Zabbix, PagerDuty or similar technologies. Preferred candidates hold a degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or have equivalent working experience.





Deep understanding of monitoring, logging, tracing and alerting standard processes and technologies.
Very good understanding of SRE (Site Reliability Engineering) standard processes.
Proficiency in scripting and automation (e.g., Python, Bash, or similar languages).
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud) and container orchestration (e.g., Kubernetes) is highly desirable.
Strong leadership and mentoring skills, with a proven track record of leading successful projects.




Good skills in written and spoken English, as well as ability to work collaborative and effectively in a team-oriented environment, also together with outside partners.

Please note If you require any reasonable accommodations or adjustments throughout the application process, please let us know. We will work with you to meet your needs.

Relocation support is not offered for this role.

Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

Research shows that women and people from different underrepresented backgrounds often only apply for a job if they meet 100% of the listed qualifications. If you dream of being a part of our team and you meet many, but not all of our listed qualifications for this role, please apply.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.

Title: Senior Engineer
Place: Billund, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Senior Engineer

Play your part in our team succeeding

You will be part of a well functional product team with responsibility to deliver digital solutions to optimize our Finance and Controlling capability in the LEGO Group.

The product team is facing a big S4 implementation the coming year, and you will play a vital role in this implementation.

You will, together with the Lead Engineer, Product owner and other important stakeholders help the LEGO Group to optimize the outcome of the Finance processes.

We work in an agile way and apply engineering, architecture, and product management practices to ensure we build what brings the most value to our customers and ensure a close feedback loop.


Core Responsibilities





Play an important role of build solutions for the Finance Product Team; understanding business requirements, configuring, testing and ensuring that our product is operating as expected in our live production environment.
Deliver business outcomes (as defined in product team’s objectives and key results) through technical solutions
Technical sparring with other IT Engineers demonstrating eagerness to teach, learn and experiment with an agile mindset
Configure the applications to fit the LEGO Needs and setup needed integrations using modern API architecture
Explore new technologies and methods and participate in prototypes with the product team
Implement and maintain solutions via configuration of our existing SAP ECC and future S4 solution.
DevOps approach “You build it – you run it - you own it” with automated testing, and CI/CD enabled pipelines.




Do you have what it takes?





5+ years of working experience with SAP – especially in the Finance and Controlling area eg. General Ledger, AP, AR, profit center accounting, Profitability analysis, Product cost controlling.
Deep business process understanding from a global manufacturing company
A Bachelor or master's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or similar is preferred.
Knowledge about system integration and use of API’s.
Strong collaboration skills – both within business and technology
Knowledge about agile methodologies and thrive with agile ways of working
Ability to work independently
Knowledge within Architectural Design and Development.
Strong communication and collaboration skills
Experience with test automation




No relocation assistance is offered for this position

Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

Research shows that women and people from different underrepresented backgrounds often only apply for a job if they meet 100% of the listed qualifications. For all candidates, if you dream of being a part of our team and you meet many, but not all of our listed qualifications for this role, please apply.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.
